Title: #SGUNITEDJOBS TECHNICAL LEAD
Description:
Some Things To Know Before You Apply
We have big plans to disrupt the traditional fundraising process for private businesses
You will work with a diverse team of former investment bankers, strategy consultants and business owners in developing innovative funding and growth strategies for clients
Everything we do is focused on helping businesses do business, better
We work really hard but play really hard as well
Job Purpose
Responsible for developing Fundnel products (fundnel.com, dealtrack.io & hg.exchange) for the next phase of growth along with our vision
Mentor and work with other software engineers
Roles & Responsibilities
Design overall architecture with a detailed plan focusing on Fundnel’s business goals
Maintain quality and ensure responsiveness of all products while collaborating with the rest of the engineering team to design and launch new features
Maintain code integrity and organization with a good understanding and execution of security and data protection
Exploring and integration of third-party APIs
Leading an internal development team in developing technical & personal skills
Conduct regular feedback reviews, assist in tech operations, facilitate standards and quality within the team and reduce technical debt
Recruit and develop top engineering talent
Keep an eye out for upcoming trends and their applicability to our technology in strengthening our product offerings
Skills & Experience Required
Full-stack development experience
At least 5-8 years of software development experience
At least 2-3 years of leading, hiring and mentoring engineers
Strong knowledge in backend development using one of the following is a must:
PHP (Yii, Laravel, Symfony), Python (Django, flask) or Ruby on Rails
Expert in JS, preferably experience with VueJS or ReactJS
Solid front-end development experience, SASS, LESS, Bootstrap, responsive web design
Experience with assets and dependency management using webpack, npm, composer
Understanding of DevOps to deploy and maintain server infrastructure
Experience with AWS services (EC2, RDS, Redis, etc.) is a bonus
Experience building REST APIs and integrating multiple systems, OAuth, token authentication
Experience with caching practices, Memcache, Redis, web server cache policies
Experience in building and maintaining databases, implementing analytics, etc.
Experience with TDD and unit testing
Bonus Attributes
Experience with Python and R
Experience with data integration from multiple sources in different languages
Have a portfolio of past data science projects
Experience with the deployment of machine learning algorithms across a cluster of machines
Experience with building classifications and regression models for machine learning algorithms, and have used scikit-learn in Python
Ruby (Ruby on Rails)
Slim template language
Queue and event-driven systems, RabbitMQ
Containerization (Docker) and build tools (Make, Rake)
CI/CD within the distributed system (Kubernetes, Capistrano)
Orchestrating microservices, daemonizing tasks, and services
Web servers (Nginx, puma)
If you are interested, please send your resume to jobs@fundnel.com
Only successful applicants will be contacted.

Title: Infrastructure Engineer
Description:
(Job Number: 01VSW)
As an Infrastructure Engineer in GovTech’s Data Science & Artificial Intelligence Division, you will be involved in managing and running data science and analytics platforms that support agencies across the Whole-of-Government. You will assist to establish and implement effective operational workflows, procedures and best practices in accordance with government infrastructure and security policies to ensure that the platforms are monitored, secure, available and reliable.

We are looking for an independent and motivated engineer who has experience in both small and large scale projects, building and maintaining the infrastructure.

What to Expect:
Managing on-prem and/or on-cloud system.
Be responsible on the IT Operations such as (but not limited to):
Maintain and optimize servers, storage, file servers and software
Devices, equipment and access management
Data backup and system security operations (e.g. user authorization, firewalls)
Manage assets and inventory tracking
Liaise with vendors and engineers for installations/replacements, upgrades and configuration of hardware, software and patches.
Administer, monitor and maintain Linux & Windows servers, storages and NAS servers and Big Data clusters.
Perform troubleshooting when systems are down
Provide 1st-2nd tier IT support to users.
Maintain and update operational documents

How to Succeed:
Diploma/Degree in Computer Science or Information Technology or related disciplines
Minimum 2 years of experience in IT Operation works. Candidates with more experiences will be considered for senior position.
Provides supports to ensure the platform is secure, available and reliable.
Provide inputs to optimise and automate existing workflows and processes so that issues from the systems can be quickly brought to attention and escalated if necessary.
Assist in evaluating new hardware and software for technical refresh.
Maintain hardware and software assets and inventory to ensure they are updated.
Set up, install, configure and deploy new servers, and perform hardening based on established guidelines and best practices.
Manage projects with vendors to set up, install, configure and deploy hardware and software, or run POCs on existing systems.
Ensure all systems have adequate hardware and software support.
Guide and mentor new staff on technical expertise on running and maintaining systems.
Schedule - Full-time
Employee Status - Direct Contract

Title: SVP / VP, Senior Site Reliability Engineer - Data Pipeline A...
Description:
Business Function

Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.
Responsibilities

While the Site Reliability Engineer | Data Pipeline Automation lead is accountable for implementation of the overall (e2e) DevOps model. S/he is specifically responsible for:
Ensuring teams are equipped appropriately;
24/7 monitoring and support processes (Singapore & DAH2) including right accesses to production (and pre-production) environments.
Ensures teams are right sized and have the right skills and tools.
Driving synergies and collaboration across all applications within Ecosystem and wider ‘tech organization’.
Will leverage agile reporting, showcases, KPIs, SLAs, OLIs, financials and other artefacts to ensure transparency and alignment across stakeholders.
Engaging relevant SMEs from all areas (e.g., architecture, design, development) to ensure teams are delivering short and long-term goals and ensuring technical excellence and quality including (automated) real-time performance updates.
Ensuring the model is aligned with the technical architecture and business goals
Actively managing risks and issues; balance the competing needs of speed to market, cost, technical excellence and zero impact production applications.
Support any internal & external audits and assessments.
Building and driving DevOps culture across the team / work as an evangelist for DevOps and SRE practices.
A proven track record of successfully implementing Dev(sec)Ops journey using Agile way of working.
Requirements
8-10+ years of experience in Dev(sec)Ops automation, CI&CD, production support, complex de-centralised and multi-disciplined teams.
Prior Developer experience preferred.
Minimum of 3-5 years of experience automating tasks and writing tools in a scripting language (e. g. Python).
Minimum of 3 years practical experience in software development using programming languages (e. g. Java).
Wide technical background:
SDLC and latest SW development practices
Cloud knowledge (Public, Hybrid, Private)
CI&CD pipeline as a concept; source control, build process, security scanning, test automation, deployment processes (Auto promotion, Blue & Green), APM.
CI&CD tools and techniques (scripting, config management, Jenkins/Bamboo, Maven/Ant)
Proven leadership skills and evidence of collaboration with developer teams and business teams.
Prior experience working in a Financial services organisation preferred but not mandatory.
Apply Now


We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Title: #SGUNITEDJOBS TECHNICAL SUPPORT ENGINEER
Description:
About the Department
The Cloudflare Customer Support Team solves complicated problems and answers technical questions via phone, email, chat and social media. Whether it is a Wordpress blogger using our services for free or a global Enterprise business with petabytes of web traffic, we are always eager to assist. We are the eyes and ears of Cloudflare, acting as the real-time voice of the customer to help communicate their needs and real-world use cases back to the rest of the company - for better service and future product development.
What You'll Do
Do you like solving complex problems? Are you an analytical thinker with a knack for non-linear logic? Do you enjoy interacting with people?
We are seeking a Technical Customer Support Engineer to join our team. You will work with our users on complicated technical support issues as well as the Technical Operations team that is responsible for running our global, distributed network. You will also build system security tools including writing web security firewall rules and build big data analytics tools. This is a position where you will learn the inner workings of Cloudflare's technology, while also getting to work directly with our customers, particularly in the APAC region.
Examples of desirable skills, knowledge and experience
2+ years of customer-facing technical support experience
Extensive experience troubleshooting DNS and networking-related issues
Familiarity with Linux and web programming
Understanding of DNS and how the Internet works
Experience with Apache, Nginx, IIS, and other web servers
You live at the command line, and only use a GUI when you have no other choice
You know that a curl isn't necessarily related to weightlifting or an Olympic sport
Experience working in a support role where you thrived every time you resolved a ticket
Strong communication skills that allow you to be a bridge between customers and the engineering team
Bonus Points
B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent
Experience with PostgreSQL, MySQL, MS SQL, and other database servers
Experience with popular blogging platforms, forum software, and/or CRM software
Interest in web security
You have worked at a hosting company or a web development company

Title: Tableau Senior Technical Engineer
Description:
Job: Technology
Primary Location: ASEAN & South Asia-Singapore-Singapore
Schedule: Full-time
Employee Status: Permanent
Posting Date: 04/May/2020
Unposting Date: Ongoing
About Standard Chartered
We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East.


To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good.


We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base.


The Role Responsibilities


The BI Senior technical Engineer is expected to have Advanced knowledge and experience with Tableau software (Desktop Pro, Server, Interactor) and role balanced, with a strong understanding of Tableau architecture and administration. In this role, the individual must hold good market knowledge of other BI Tools in the space of data discovery, data modelling, data visualisation, predictive analytics, prescriptive & descriptive analytics. In this role, the individual should be a team player and should have sound knowledge of new technologies in the BI space. This is a multitasking role and the individual is expected to support multiple BI BOW and operations teams as well as a large and diverse Tableau user community. This role will report into the Head of BI Reporting.

Mandatory Technical / Functional Skills :
Advanced knowledge and experience with Tableau software (Desktop Pro, Server, Interactor) and role balanced, with a strong understanding
Knowledge of Tableau System Administration (includes site creation, server maintenance/Upgrades/patches).
Knowledge of Change management including software, hardware upgrades, patches
Capable of Monitoring/building workbooks to manage server activity/usage statistics to identify possible performance issues/enhancements
Sound Knowledge in Performance tuning / Server management of tableau server environment (clustering, Load balancing).
Strong Knowledge in BI tools including ETL, Data Warehousing, other BI tools.
Manage and support migration of objects (dimensions, measures, hierarchies, reports, workbooks, dashboards), from development to production environments
Sound knowledge of SCB processes to traverse through licensing, new node procurements, License procurements etc
Manage BOW and coordinate prioritization activities across technical and non-technical teams
Develop and document standards/best practices for development and administration of the Tableau platform
Provide status to the senior management team and keep stakeholders apprised of key project activities
Partner with business to design tableau KPI scorecards & dashboards
Provide appropriate training and support to business users on the use of Tableau interactive web reports, and Tableau Desktop
Challenge teams to deliver appropriate quality standards in all work products
Work with senior management in supporting the BI visualisation roadmap for the Bank
Maintain enterprise data management processes, governance, standards and compliance
Our Ideal Candidate

Skills /Abilities and Knowledge
Advanced knowledge and experience with Tableau software (Desktop Pro, Server, Interactor), with a strong understanding of Tableau architecture and administration.
Experience as Tableau administrator, developing in, configuring and administering Tableau Server.
Strong development skills in Tableau and data analytics and visualizations
Strong Knowledge in BI tools including ETL, Data Warehousing, other BI tools.
Experience in Tableau scripting (TABCMD and TABADMIN).
Ability to architect a stable Tableau solution guaranteed for high operational availability.
Experience working with Relational Databases (SQL Server - required, Oracle).
Expertise in Tableau platform sizing, troubleshooting, tuning & disaster recovery.
Good knowledge of Tableau Metadata tables
Education
Bachelor’s degree in information technology or related field, or equivalent experience
Related Work Experience
Experience in BI role working specifically with Business Community producing analytical reports/dashboards, predictive analytics, ROI calculations demonstrating value of BI
Experience in using the below components in Tableau
Tableau Server Management Module
Tableau Power Tools
Tableau Desktop Professional
Experience working in a mixed methodology environment (Agile / waterfall / hybrid)
Experience working with a blended onsite and offshore staffing model and leading offshore team members on the technical deliverables
Certifications
Tableau Certified Server Administrator
Tableau Certified Desktop Professional
Tableau Certified Analyst
Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions.


To view information on our benefits including our flexible working please visit our career pages.

Title: Singapore
Description:
Job Description
Lazada (Alibaba Group), the Southeast Asia’s largest online shopping mall is seeking a profile with strong technical background and experience in Detection and Response, to lead our Security Operations Team. SecOps defines, monitors security alerts and responds to security incidents across 6 Asian countries. We have to overcome a lot of challenges working in large scale and dynamic environment with Alibaba cutting-edge technology.

What we will offer to you?
A personal career development plan and follow-up
A dynamic working environment constantly evolving using modern technologies (cloud computing, big data, AI)
A great working environment with no silo where people are open-minded and helpful.

Responsibilities:
Manage/coach Security Operations team
Increase our Detection and Response maturity
Develop our Cyber Threat Intelligence capability
Improve Incident Response plan and procedures
Organise Incident Response simulations
Handle cyber security incidents (coordination and hands-on)



Job Requirements
3 years in handling critical cybersecurity incidents (intrusion) on Linux and Windows
2 years of experience working in a SOC/CERT/CSIRT or equivalent
2 years as a Team Leader
Excellent communication skills and used to present to C-Level
Adaptability and excellent negociatiation skills
Structured, organised and autonomous
English working proficiency
Ready to work on-call and overtime in a fast-paced environment
Able to travel on occasion in South-East Asia and China

Good to have
Automation skills (Python, API, Java, etc). Tools shared on Github.
Offensive security hands-on
Knowledge in Data Analytics, Big Data, Machine Learning
Experience in implementing Tactical Threat Intelligence
Good knowledge of ATT&CK Framework
Static Malware Analysis and Reverse Engineering
Infrastructure/system engineer experience
Project management / Agile experience
Publications and Public event talks
OSCP, OSCE, GCIH, GCFA, GCTI, GREM, and any blue/red team certification

Shortlisted candidates will be evaluated technically with a writing and an oral test

Title: Data Engineer (Manager / Senior Manager), Programme Evaluati...
Description:
Overview of Programme Evaluation Department
To advance the transformation of health promotion through the adoption of a systems and multi-disciplinary approach to programme evaluation, as well as leveraging big data and advanced analytics to drive the vision towards precision public health.

Responsibilities
Develop a robust data strategy to support better access, integration and use of big data
Drive and implement processes related to data ingestion, cleaning, integration and access
Drive and implement data governance processes
Drive & perform user acceptance test for platform features & data transformation deliverables

Requirements
Qualifications in computer science, software engineering, business analytics, statistics or equivalent, or candidates with other disciplines with relevant experience are welcomed to apply
At least 3 to 5 years of experience in data mining, analytics, technology or designing, developing and database management
Familiarity in user acceptance test process for system implementations and/or aggregated data reports
Proficient in the use of ETL/programming softwares, e.g. Python, R, KNIME, SQL, MS SQL server, SAS, Power BI
Possess strong experience in data quality management and monitoring
Experience related to data privacy, protection and governance work
Familiarity with data governance policies in the public sector or IT security and tools related to data privacy and protection would be a plus
Numbers-savvy and possess strong problem solving and critical thinking skills
Aptitude in building collaborative relationships and engaging with a wide range of stakeholders with differing data handling experiences
Strong problem solving and project management skills and able to think independently to offer resolutions to issues or barriers stakeholders may face

Title: Associate Product Manager
Description:
Our Team
Connecting the realms of traditional physical assets with cutting-edge digital ones, Mighty Jaxx is a leading urban culture company specialising in creating unique content that are developed into quality products across multiple categories such as art collectibles and lifestyle items, all powered by technology.
Since our inception in 2012, we have produced over 1,000 designs in collaboration with world-renowned artists and entertainment brands like Warner Media and Sesame Workshop, and have delivered over 1,000,000 units to collectors in over 60 countries.
Our technology team is made up of fast-paced, creative and fun-loving individuals with a goal to empower and engage every collector and artist around the world. This is core to everything we do and we pride ourselves in always taking an innovative, data-centric yet considerate approach in creating the right experiences, products and content for our collectors. With big dreams and a grand mission, we’re looking for great like-minded people to join us.
If you’re looking for an opportunity to learn, grow, and really drive impact, this is perfect for you!
The Job
As a product manager you will work together with a team to develop and improve the following products: -
Web Apps
Mobile Apps (Android and iOS)
Incentive Systems
Shopping experiences
Marketplaces
Responsibilities
Work closely with business stakeholders to develop good product vision, roadmaps, ROI and execute it as the product manager.
Add value to the business through engagements in a development project as product manager. This includes, but not limited to, requirements analysis, design, testing/verification, operation/maintenance, OKR / KPI management and product support.
Work closely with the tech lead and other engineers to achieve project objectives. You will be working with teammates in different locations such as Vietnam.
Understand business needs and user behaviour, and to develop solutions to those needs.
Capture improvement points based on our KPIs and create/execute an improvement plan.
Requirements
2 years of working experience in a software company (any role).
Experience in writing spec documents such as Screen Transition, UI, Input Validation, Error Handling, Data Definition, Data Flow.
Experience in analyzing KPIs using Domo, SiteCatalyst, Google Analytics etc. and taking corrective actions to ensure the product meets targets and forecasts.
Capable of understanding product strategy and roadmaps to execute the project with the team.
Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills
Able to build strong working relationships with technical and non-technical staff.
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to motivate and guide team members to establish positive working relationships and achieve goals together
Strong skills and experience to develop quality assurance plan and procedures.
Experience with defect tracking tools such as JIRA.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $4,000.00 to $5,000.00 /month

Title: Senior Data Engineer
Description:
We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer to work in Tokyo, Japan who is excited to build the next-generation data processing that can handle large scale workloads. The right candidate has a solid background in setting up complex and scalable CI pipelines and a good understanding of Machine Learning.
RESPONSIBILITY
・Maintain and continuously improve large scale iterative labelling, experimenting, training, and deploying processing pipelines for modern deep learning on cameras, LiDARs, radars, and other sensor data.
・Communicate, scope and design new features to meet the needs of clients inside and outside of the company
・Develop and integrate data handling tools and work with teams to provide ground-truth in support of machine learning and simulation.
・Live and breathe the software practices that produce maintainable code, including automated testing, continuous integration, code style conformity, and code review.

TECHNICAL QUALIFICATIONS
Software engineering
・Service oriented architecture
・Microservices
・Experience with devtools: Jira, Github, Gitlab, Jenkins, Artifactory
・Experience with building, owning, managing and operating data platforms

Infrastructure
・Infrastructure as Code: Terraform
・Containers: Docker
・AWS experience including:
・・・Compute: EC2, ECS, EKS, Lambda, Batch
・・・Storage: S3
・・・Database: DynamoDB, Redshift
・・・Networking: API Gateway
・・・Security / Identity: IAM, Cognito
・・・Application Integration: Step functions, SQS, SNS
・Big Data / Analytics: Glue, EMR, Athena, Kinesis, ElasticSearch, Quicksight, Spark

Data
We require experience with one of the following:
・Computer vision and image processing
・Sensor processing and fusion
・Time series data processing
・Deep learning frameworks and building software on top of these frameworks such as PyTorch and Tensorflow

Soft Skills
・Excellent communication and organization skills
・Business level English
・Agile mindset
・Strong sense of ownership

Title: Lead Data Engineer (Hadoop / Python / MatLab)
Description:
Opportunity to work with Advanced Technologies
High Impact Position
About Our Client
Our client is an upcoming Technology Platform and they are looking for a highly motivated Lead Data Engineer (Hadoop / Python / MatLab) to work with a diverse team of technical resources, product managers and develop advanced technology solutions.
Job Description
As the Lead Data Engineer (Hadoop / Python / MatLab), you are responsible for:
Identifying, reviewing, and determining the value of unstructured data from multiple sources before designing scalable systems to ingest the relevant data.
Developing the blueprint design for the data architecture on cloud platforms, ensuring scalability and efficiency.
Owning the data pipelines and driving continuous improvements in data quality reports.
Designing data models to support analytics reports, data transformation and data science models.
Collaborating with Industry Experts and Software Engineers to refine the selection of data sources and optimize the data collection process.
The Successful Applicant
As a successful applicant, you will have a Degree in Business Analytics or equivalent with at least 5 years of experience in the Data Engineering field, backed by strong working experience with both unstructured and structured data. You will also have a proven track record of working with Big Data tools such as Hadoop / Spark / Hive, coupled with relevant scripting experience using Python with NoSQL databases such as MongoDB / PostgreSQL.
You will have a strong experience with statistical programming tools such as MatLab / R / SAS in a UNIX / LINUX environment. You will also have relevant experience with data modelling and creating predictive models.
What's on Offer
Opportunity to work with Advanced Technologies
High Impact Position
Attractive Salary Package

Title: #SGUNITEDJOBS SOFTWARE ENGINEER
Description:
Proven working experience as a data analyst, with experience in large data warehousing and Hadoop implementation projects in financial services industry
Good functional knowledge of Retail bank, Wholesale & Global Markets products & business processes
Hands on experience in executing analytics projects in Finance domain - expertise in Financial Reconciliation, Attribution, Profitability Reporting, Fund Transfer Pricing, Attribution, Budgeting, Forecasting
Experience with Credit & Market Risk analytics - Risk Weighed Assets, PD, LGD, ECL, Economic Capital, NPL, Regulatory reporting (MAS , BASEL, S29) , Industry Concentration, Country of Risk, Disclosures, Counterparty Risk Reporting
Knowledge & experience of mapping attributes from products such as SAP GL, OFSA, Moody’s RaY, Murex, Silver Lake Core Banking, Trade Finance, Remittance would be of additional advantage
Good expertise in designing financial services data models & data modeling tools
Expertise with industry standards data models such as FSLDM & dimensional models to support reporting needs
Good experience in implementing data governance processes
Experience in data profiling, implementing data quality rules & providing end to end data lineage
Knowledge & experience with reference data management, data standards, expertise with Teradata MDM

Description:
Job Description
Perform ad-hoc data analysis and provide high quality data analysis/insight to finance function.
Develop End-to-end Business Intelligence (BI) solutions for finance function.
Coordinate with data engineering team on relevant backend DB and data pipeline development (ETL)
Collaborate with finance stakeholders, data engineers and BI teams on technical analysis, project status update/review, testing & issue resolution.
Develop an in-depth understanding of the underlying data, data model and business domain by investigating, reviewing and analysing data from structured & unstructured sources.
Create & maintain online documentation of BI reporting logic and processes for both - internal usage in BI and as end-user training materials.
Job Requirements
Very strong Big Data/SQL skills (Compulsory).
Strong education background with quantitative degrees in Accounting, Applied Economics/Mathematic/Statistic, Computer Science/Information Systems (preferred).
Have a strong passion for data analysis/modelling.
More than 5 years of experience in end-to-end BI implementation and solution development; a strong combination of BI development, data analytics and business analysis experience highly desirable.
Strong understanding of database & data warehouse design/administration, hands-on experience with MySQL, Hadoop, Hive SQL, Flink / Spark technology and Python.
MS Excel/VBA, SAP FICO/ABAP Programming hands-on experience a plus.
Ability to work independently and escalate issues and seek guidance as necessary.
Strong analytical/problem-solving skill balance with good written and oral communication skills.

Tenacity to develop ideas independently and thrive in a fast-paced start-up environment.
A self-motivated, driven, flexible, quick learning, high achieving, “can do” mentality.

Title: Data Engineer
Senior VP, Advanced Threat Research
Description:
About UOB
United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.
Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.
About the Department
The Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches.
Job Responsibilities
Provide direct leadership, management, and operational oversight for our Level 3 engineers as well as execution of enhanced cyber security capabilities build-up programs.
Responsible for engineering design and development of cyber security technology along with integration of new architectural features into existing infrastructures while maintaining the integrity and security of enterprise-wide cyber security systems and networks.
Provide technical and security expertise to IT and business leadership and technical teams to identify cost-effective and appropriate security technology solutions and develop security reference architectures and strategies to achieve business results.
Develop/integrate cyber security solutions with multi-level security requirements for enhanced monitoring and detection capability
Maintain awareness of trends and issues in area of security expertise, evaluate new security technologies opportunities, and provide analysis of their potential advantage to the business.

Others:
Perform as a member of the Cyber security capability enhancement team to drive or participate in product evaluation, project discussion and deployments
Work within established practices and handling guidelines to develop and deploy preventive maintenance processes for GSOC infrastructure
Work with internal technical teams and engineers in technical troubleshooting, exercises and forums
Available to respond to client requests and assist with troubleshooting activities
Able to resolve customer related issues with minimal guidance
Communicate effectively with a variety of internal teams and external contacts including technical and executive contacts
Capable of juggling variety of priorities and deliverables in an interrupt driven environment with minimal guidance or supervision
Job Requirements
Education
Preferred Degree in engineering/Computer Science / IT/Cyber Security from a recognized education institution
Professional security related qualification (e.g. SANS GCIA, GCIH etc.) is favorable

Technical Skills and experience
Min 10-15 years of relevant Cyber security experience
Expert knowledge in networking technology and network security (i.e. Firewalls, WAF, IDS, IPS, VPN, HIPS, ADS, SIEM, UBA and TCP/IP protocols)
Minimum 5 years of relevant working experience in a SOC environment and leading a team of highly skilled Cyber Engineers
Familiar with SOC processes
Understanding of threat response and incident response
Understanding in Unix/Linux and Windows administration
Understanding in Security Information Event Management System (SIEMS) example: HP ArcSight / Splunk
Strong foundation in security threat TTPs and attack counter measure
Analytical problem solver and good at troubleshooting technical issues
Effective time management and organizational skills
Operational knowledge of SIEMS, Breach Detection System, Network Forensic System, Big Data analytics, User Behavior Analytics and endpoint security technology
Understanding of malware analysis platforms and tools
Understanding of threat intelligence platforms and tools
Technical/logical understanding of FW/IDS/IPS/WAF rule and SIEM rule construction
Programming, concepts and scripting languages – Python, Ruby, Power-shell, Java, C/C++, Regex, STIX
Good understanding of network forensics and packet analysis
Good understanding of SQL/Database, SOAP-XML, Restful API
Good understanding of internet concepts and technologies – internet services, search engines, open source tools, android/iOS - mobile technology, LAMP, iOT, TOR etc.

Soft Skills
Good written and verbal communication skills
Process and procedure adherence
Strong analytical and problem solving skill
Be a part of UOB Family
Apply now and make a difference.

Title: Graduate Engineer Trainee
Description:
Graduate Engineer Trainee (Singapore)

In Onwards Media Group, we always strive to nurture future leaders. We are now offering an opportunity for graduates with computer science or engineering background to join our young and talented software engineering team with mentorship from industry experts and visionaries, and the first step to an exciting career in one of the most promising industries.

During the 2-year programme, you will be exposed to multiple facets of modern technologies including:

Multimedia technologies including video streaming, encoding and other advanced media processing techniques
Mobile and web app development
Big data analytics, deep learning and other cognitive algorithms
DevOps, clustering and cloud technologies

Programme structure:
1-month training in engineering concepts, discipline and modern software development methodology and process
Rotation between our engineering teams with specific in-depth training and assignments, 3 to 6 months each
Join one of the project teams for complete solution development

We are looking for university or polytechnic graduates in the year 2016 or 2017, in Computer Science, Information Engineering, Electronic Engineering or related disciplines.
Upon successful completion of the programme, you will be given a permanent role in one of our engineering teams where you can further develop your expertise in.
To apply, simple send a cover letter with your school project experience to: talent@onwardsmg.com

Title: Data Modeler - SG
Description:
Key Areas of Responsibility
Design and maintain the Conceptual and Logical Data Models across the Retail, Private and Wealth Banking domains
Conduct data modelling enabling activities including the development of Data Dictionary, Physical Data Models, data format specifications, model releases, data harmonization and mapping across the data models
Manage the conformed dimension model to ensure that analytic and physical data models are in alignment with data architecture goals and framework
Design, implement, and support data warehousing requirements and enforce processes to ensure a consistent, well-managed, and well-integrated data infrastructure.
Perform data requirement gathering, documentation and use case interpretation for the design of target data model/data mart
Map data attributes from different source systems to the target data models and ensure the adherence to business rules
Create data mapping templates for Data Model mapping
Work closely with the big data engineers to create optimal physical data models of datasets.
Define and employ data modelling and design standards, tools, best practices, and related development methodologies.
Ensure that data use is compliant to the data architecture principles including golden sources and standard reference data
Profile data attributes to assess data quality that affects referential integrity and provide remediation recommendations
Possess good understanding of the Big Data ecosystem and data modelling nuances on the Hadoop ecosystem.
Provide proactive technical oversight and advice to application architecture and development teams fostering re-use, design for scale, stability, and operational efficiency of data/analytical solutions

The ideal candidate will have a hands-on background of working in large complex organizations with multiple data requirements. He/She will have demonstrable understanding of information and data, supporting delivery of business outcomes, and data modelling expertise in the context of organizational business architecture and IT architecture.

Basic Qualifications
10+ years of data architecture and data modelling
Expertise in data modelling principles/methods including conceptual, logical and physical data models.
Experience of using PowerDesigner, ERwin or similar data modelling tool.
Experience of data modelling in the Hadoop Ecosystem.
Preferred experience working with popular enterprise logical data models, eg. Teradata FSLDM.
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science (or equivalent)

Title: Senior Data Security Engineer
Description:
An exciting Senior Data Security Engineer job has just become available at a leading telecommunications company in Singapore. Reporting directly to the Director of Data Platform and Management, this is a role for someone who has data security exposure within a multinational organisation.
About the Senior Data Security Engineer Role:
In this business critical role, you will work closely with the director on establishment, development, expansion and optimisation of data control architecture, with a specific focus on data security.
Key Responsibilities:
Design, develop and implement data security, privacy, protection and associated control technology solutions (big data) as per best industry practices
Evaluate and renew implemented data security, privacy, overall data control solutions to ensure their relevance and effectiveness in supporting business needs and regulatory requirement (PDPA, GDPR, Telecom act, etc.)
Drive the development, optimisation, testing and tooling to improve overall data control management (security, consent management, privacy, protection)
Design and implement data security, privacy, protection framework and optimised service and access management
Understand business requirements and solutions design to develop and implement solutions that adhere to big data architectural guidelines, address regulatory and compliance requirements
Design, develop and maintain data security and privacy framework, policy, solution and systems
Design, develop and maintain data protection and consent management systems
Drive BAU process, testing and tooling to improve data security, privacy and protection
Understand the latest data security standards and tools to apply and adhere to the required data controls for user access in Cloudera/Hadoop, Oracle and other DB platform and overall data environments and projects
Support and contribute to development guidelines and standards for data security, privacy with risk, compliance, regulatory functions
To succeed in this role, you must have a bachelor’s degree in IT, computer science, software engineering, data/business analytic or equivalent.
Key Requirements:
Data management, security, privacy, protection-related qualification/certification (e.g. DAMA, Symantec CSP in Data Protection, Certified McAfee Security Specialis or Expert, or RSA Certified McAfee Security Specialist CMSS - DLP Focus, Websense Data Security Suite (DSS) Professional) dynamic data masking, data privacy
10 - 12 years of experience in data warehousing/big data/Hadoop /RDBMS – Security, Privacy, Protection technologies and tools
Expert in building data management solutions - data security, privacy solutions, architectures and implementation
Ability to troubleshoot and issue resolution complex security, privacy requirements
Experience with structured and unstructured data design/modelling, data access, security and data storage techniques
Experience with relational SQL and NOSQL DB
Experience in telco data warehouse and/or data lake
Experience in multiple (end to end) data security, privacy, protection implementations and ope-rationalisation
Informatica data management tools (EDC, AXON, Secure@source, IDQ, BDQ), IBM Guardium Data Protection or equivalent
Data encryption, security management techniques and methodology
Data masking – Informatica Suite, Protegrity, Oracle/Teradata Dynamic Masking or equivalent
Data management tech stack – AWS KMS, thales, etc.
This international telecommunication company needs no introduction and is recognised as the leading company in their field of expertise. With great clients and known for their flexibility in adaptation, they’ve won many businesses in the growing APAC region. The culture is demanding but if you are confident and have a can-do attitude the potential rewards are significant. The firm is also very focused on developing and training their people to the highest standards.
If you are driven, determined and want to take the next step in your career, this is the role for you. Great career progression opportunities await the right person in this exciting Senior Data Security Engineer job.
Apply today or contact me at 6228 5399 to discuss this new opportunity. Alternatively, send your resume to jay.teo@robertwalters.com.sg.

High Impact Position
About Our Client
Our client is an upcoming Technology Platform and they are looking for a highly motivated Lead Data Engineer (Hadoop / Python / MatLab) to work with a diverse team of technical resources, product managers and develop advanced technology solutions.

Description:
Do you like working with big data? Do you like growing a team from the beginning and establishing the Data Engineering function in Singapore? If yes, we in Ads group want to talk to you. As the first Manager for Data Engineering in Singapore for the Ads and Business Platform (ABP) pillar, you will be key in managing the existing data engineers and growing the function in Singapore This is your opportunity to shape the culture of a growing function in Singapore, in line with the company values and create a high performing team of Data Engineers. This is also an opportunity to get exposed to a broad range of products that the Singapore location supports, and create impact by discovering analytics gaps and blind spots for those products along with improving them. Whether you are a seasoned leader or someone who has been in leadership for a short period, this is a role that will allow you to start with a small team, allowing time to get a deep understanding along with an opportunity to take on a bigger leadership role over time. The perfect candidate will have strong data infrastructure and data architecture skills, a proven track record of leading and scaling data teams, strong operational skills to drive efficiency and speed, strong project management leadership, and a strong vision for how data engineering can proactively create positive impact for companies. This is a full-time position based in our Singapore office.
Data Engineering Manager Responsibilities
Proactively drive the vision for data engineering across product verticals in Singapore, and define and execute on a plan to achieve that vision.
Build a high-quality data engineering team and design the team to scale.
Build cross-functional relationships with Data Scientists, Product Managers and Software Engineers to understand data needs and deliver on those needs.
Drive the design, building, and launching of new data models and data pipelines in production.
Manage development of data resources and support new product launches.
Drive data quality across the product vertical and related business areas.
Manage the delivery of high impact dashboards and data visualisations.
Define and manage SLA’s for all data sets and processes running in production.
Minimum Qualifications
6+ years of experience in Data Engineering, BI or Data Warehousing.
Experience scaling and managing 3+ person teams.
Communication and leadership experience, with experience initiating and driving projects.
Experience in SQL or similar languages and development experience in at least one scripting language (Python, Perl, etc.).
Project management experience.
Data architecture experience.
BA/BS in Computer Science, Math, Physics, or other technical fields.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience in a consumer web or mobile company.
Experience with data sets, Hive, and data visualization tools.
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities — we're just getting started.

Title: Technical Lead
Description:
Some Things To Know Before You Apply
We have big plans to disrupt the traditional fundraising process for private businesses
You will work with a diverse team of former investment bankers, strategy consultants and business owners in developing innovative funding and growth strategies for clients
Everything we do is focused on helping businesses do business, better
We work really hard but play really hard as well
Job Purpose
Responsible for developing Fundnel products (fundnel.com, dealtrack.io & hg.exchange) for the next phase of growth along with our vision
Mentor and work with other software engineers
Roles & Responsibilities
Design overall architecture with a detailed plan focusing on Fundnel’s business goals
Maintain quality and ensure responsiveness of all products while collaborating with the rest of the engineering team to design and launch new features
Maintain code integrity and organisation with a good understanding and execution of security and data protection
Exploring and integration of third-party APIs
Leading an internal development team in developing technical & personal skills
Conduct regular feedback reviews, assist in tech operations, facilitate standards and quality within the team and reduce technical debt
Recruit and develop top engineering talent
Keep an eye out for upcoming trends and their applicability to our technology in strengthening our product offerings

Full stack development experience
At least 5-8 years of software development experience
At least 2-3 years of leading, hiring and mentoring engineers

PHP (Yii, Laravel, Symfony), Python (Django, flask) or Ruby on Rails

Web servers (nginx, puma)

Title: Senior Engineer/Engineer, Information Systems
Description:
At DSTA, we develop leading-edge technological and engineering solutions for the defence and security of our nation. Look forward to comprehensive professional and personal development programmes, and grow in a collaborative and dynamic environment. Join us in the engineering, IT or the corporate domains to make an impact on the defence and security of the nation!
Opportunity
We are looking for an individual to join us in our Information Programme Centre where you will work in a data-rich domain to develop technologies in artificial intelligence and machine learning for big data analysis. The role will require you to:
Develop systems for a broad spectrum of mission critical tasks
Use advanced technologies to accelerate decision-making on the battlefield
You can look forward to opportunities to work with renowned local and overseas companies and research institutes.
Requirements
Tertiary qualification in Computer Science, Information Systems, Computer Engineering, or related fields
Proficiency in programming languages such as Java, and knowledge of relational and non-relational databases
Knowledge of Geographical Information Systems, data analytics and deep learning concepts, technologies and tools will be helpful
Knowledge of technologies such as HBase, Spark, Solr, Kudu will be an advantage
Good problem-solving, writing and presentation skills
Candidates with relevant working experience may be considered for a Senior Engineer position.

Title: IT Data Consultant
Description:
Role Summary

You will be responsible for building the business' data collection systems and processing highly available data pipelines that facilitate deeper analysis and reporting by the business users. You will also be building data processing frameworks that handle the business's growing database and will work with the business users in leveraging data with reporting and scientific tools. In addition, you will strive to continuously develop new and improved data engineering capabilities.

Job Responsibilities
Implement strategies directed at acquiring data and promoting the development of new insights across the business. You will own and extend the business's data pipeline through the collection, storage, processing, and transformation of large data-sets.
Monitor the existing metrics, analyze data, and work with business users to identify and implement system and process improvements.
Develop queries for ad hoc business projects, as well as ongoing reporting. In this capacity, you will build a metadata system where all available data is maintained and catalogued. You will also play a major role in the development of reliable data pipelines that translate raw data into powerful features and signals.
Designs, architects, implements, and supports key datasets that avail structured and timely access to actionable business insights. You will also be responsible with developing ETL processes that convert data into formats through dashboard charts.
Work closely with the business users in gathering requirements for data governance across the department and the business at large.
Apply best practices as well as defining the business's data requirements, which will ensure that the collected data is of a high quality and optimal for use across the departments and business at large.
Analyze and understand data sources, participating in design, and providing insights and guidance on database technology and data modelling best practices.
Develop and manage scalable data processing platforms that will be used for exploratory data analysis and real-time analytics. You will oversee, design, and develop algorithms for real-time data processing within the business and to create the frameworks that enable quick and efficient data acquisition.
Retrieve and analyze data using SQL, Excel among other data management systems. You will also build data loading services for importing data from numerous disparate data sources, inclusive of APIs, logs, relational, and non-relational databases.
Contribute to the continual improvement of the business's data platforms.
Job Requirements
Degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, Information Technology or related fields.
Relevant experience in working within a data engineering department, preferably as a Data Engineer in a fast-paced environment and complex business setting
Demonstrate experience in building and maintaining reliable and scalable ETL on big data platforms as well as experience working with varied forms of data infrastructure inclusive of relational databases such as SQL, Hadoop, Spark and column-oriented databases such as Redshift, MySQL, and Vertica.
Experience in data warehousing inclusive of dimensional modelling concepts and demonstrate proficiency in scripting languages, for example, Python, Perl, etc.
Experience in working in SQL server reporting services, analysis services, Tableau, Salesforce, integration services, or any other data visualization tools.
Ability to perform complex data analyses with large data volumes.
Proficient in SQL, Java, and have a keen understanding of data models and data warehouse concepts.
Experience working with big data infrastructure tools such as Python, SQS, Redshift, Scala, Spark, Spark Streaming, AWS and/or EMR.
Andy, Wee Ben Ann License No. 02C3423 Personnel Registration No. R1552080

Title: Senior VP, Advanced Threat Research, Group Information Secur...
Description:
About UOBUnited Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.About the DepartmentThe Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches.Job Responsibilities
Provide direct leadership, management, and operational oversight for our Level 3 engineers as well as execution of enhanced cyber security capabilities build-up programs.
Responsible for engineering design and development of cyber security technology along with integration of new architectural features into existing infrastructures while maintaining the integrity and security of enterprise-wide cyber security systems and networks.
Provide technical and security expertise to IT and business leadership and technical teams to identify cost-effective and appropriate security technology solutions and develop security reference architectures and strategies to achieve business results.
Develop/integrate cyber security solutions with multi-level security requirements for enhanced monitoring and detection capability
Maintain awareness of trends and issues in area of security expertise, evaluate new security technologies opportunities, and provide analysis of their potential advantage to the business.

Others:
Perform as a member of the Cyber security capability enhancement team to drive or participate in product evaluation, project discussion and deployments
Work within established practices and handling guidelines to develop and deploy preventive maintenance processes for GSOC infrastructure
Work with internal technical teams and engineers in technical troubleshooting, exercises and forums
Available to respond to client requests and assist with troubleshooting activities
Able to resolve customer related issues with minimal guidance
Communicate effectively with a variety of internal teams and external contacts including technical and executive contacts
Capable of juggling variety of priorities and deliverables in an interrupt driven environment with minimal guidance or supervision

Job Requirements

Education

Preferred Degree in engineering/Computer Science / IT/Cyber Security from a recognized education institution
Professional security related qualification (e.g. SANS GCIA, GCIH etc.) is favorable

Technical Skills and experience

Min 10-15 years of relevant Cyber security experience
Expert knowledge in networking technology and network security (i.e. Firewalls, WAF, IDS, IPS, VPN, HIPS, ADS, SIEM, UBA and TCP/IP protocols)
Minimum 5 years of relevant working experience in a SOC environment and leading a team of highly skilled Cyber Engineers
Familiar with SOC processes
Understanding of threat response and incident response
Understanding in Unix/Linux and Windows administration
Understanding in Security Information Event Management System (SIEMS) example: HP ArcSight / Splunk
Strong foundation in security threat TTPs and attack counter measure
Analytical problem solver and good at troubleshooting technical issues
Effective time management and organizational skills
Operational knowledge of SIEMS, Breach Detection System, Network Forensic System, Big Data analytics, User Behavior Analytics and endpoint security technology
Understanding of malware analysis platforms and tools
Understanding of threat intelligence platforms and tools
Technical/logical understanding of FW/IDS/IPS/WAF rule and SIEM rule construction
Programming, concepts and scripting languages – Python, Ruby, Power-shell, Java, C/C++, Regex, STIX
Good understanding of network forensics and packet analysis
Good understanding of SQL/Database, SOAP-XML, Restful API
Good understanding of internet concepts and technologies – internet services, search engines, open source tools, android/iOS - mobile technology, LAMP, iOT, TOR etc.

Soft Skills

Good written and verbal communication skills
Process and procedure adherence
Strong analytical and problem solving skill

Be a part of UOB FamilyApply now and make a difference.

Title: Associate Product Manager
Description:
Our Team
Connecting the realms of traditional physical assets with cutting-edge digital ones, Mighty Jaxx is a leading urban culture company specialising in creating unique content that are developed into quality products across multiple categories such as art collectibles and lifestyle items, all powered by technology.
Since our inception in 2012, we have produced over 1,000 designs in collaboration with world-renowned artists and entertainment brands like Warner Media and Sesame Workshop, and have delivered over 1,000,000 units to collectors in over 60 countries.
Our technology team is made up of fast-paced, creative and fun-loving individuals with a goal to empower and engage every collector and artist around the world. This is core to everything we do and we pride ourselves in always taking an innovative, data-centric yet considerate approach in creating the right experiences, products and content for our collectors. With big dreams and a grand mission, we’re looking for great like-minded people to join us.
If you’re looking for an opportunity to learn, grow, and really drive impact, this is perfect for you!
The Job
As a product manager you will work together with a team to develop and improve the following products: -
Web Apps
Mobile Apps (Android and iOS)
Incentive Systems
Shopping experiences
Marketplaces
Responsibilities
Work closely with business stakeholders to develop good product vision, roadmaps, ROI and execute it as the product manager.
Add value to the business through engagements in a development project as product manager. This includes, but not limited to, requirements analysis, design, testing/verification, operation/maintenance, OKR / KPI management and product support.
Work closely with the tech lead and other engineers to achieve project objectives. You will be working with teammates in different locations such as Vietnam.
Understand business needs and user behaviour, and to develop solutions to those needs.
Capture improvement points based on our KPIs and create/execute an improvement plan.
Requirements
2 years of working experience in a software company (any role).
Experience in writing spec documents such as Screen Transition, UI, Input Validation, Error Handling, Data Definition, Data Flow.
Experience in analyzing KPIs using Domo, SiteCatalyst, Google Analytics etc. and taking corrective actions to ensure the product meets targets and forecasts.
Capable of understanding product strategy and roadmaps to execute the project with the team.
Excellent verbal and written communication and presentation skills
Able to build strong working relationships with technical and non-technical staff.
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to motivate and guide team members to establish positive working relationships and achieve goals together
Strong skills and experience to develop quality assurance plan and procedures.
Experience with defect tracking tools such as JIRA.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: $4,000.00 to $5,000.00 /month

Title: #SGUNITEDJOBS TECHNICAL SUPPORT ENGINEER
Description:
About the Department
The Cloudflare Customer Support Team solves complicated problems and answers technical questions via phone, email, chat and social media. Whether it is a Wordpress blogger using our services for free or a global Enterprise business with petabytes of web traffic, we are always eager to assist. We are the eyes and ears of Cloudflare, acting as the real-time voice of the customer to help communicate their needs and real-world use cases back to the rest of the company - for better service and future product development.
What You'll Do
Do you like solving complex problems? Are you an analytical thinker with a knack for non-linear logic? Do you enjoy interacting with people?
We are seeking a Technical Customer Support Engineer to join our team. You will work with our users on complicated technical support issues as well as the Technical Operations team that is responsible for running our global, distributed network. You will also build system security tools including writing web security firewall rules and build big data analytics tools. This is a position where you will learn the inner workings of Cloudflare's technology, while also getting to work directly with our customers, particularly in the APAC region.
Examples of desirable skills, knowledge and experience
2+ years of customer-facing technical support experience
Extensive experience troubleshooting DNS and networking-related issues
Familiarity with Linux and web programming
Understanding of DNS and how the Internet works
Experience with Apache, Nginx, IIS, and other web servers
You live at the command line, and only use a GUI when you have no other choice
You know that a curl isn't necessarily related to weightlifting or an Olympic sport
Experience working in a support role where you thrived every time you resolved a ticket
Strong communication skills that allow you to be a bridge between customers and the engineering team
Bonus Points
B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent
Experience with PostgreSQL, MySQL, MS SQL, and other database servers
Experience with popular blogging platforms, forum software, and/or CRM software
Interest in web security
You have worked at a hosting company or a web development company

Title: Data Engineer
Company: GMP RECRUITMENT SERVICES S PTE LTD
Description:
Responsibilities: Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture, Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc. Apply architecture and system design theories and principles, perform complex work in research, design and development of new or existing products, tools and processes required for the operation, maintenance and testing of products. Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and AWS Azure ‘big data’ technologies. Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics. Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs. Embed DevOps processes in delivery – ensure usability is front of mind in Tech Product development. Keep our data separated and secure across national boundaries through multiple data centers and Azure platforms. Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader. Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems. Experience using the following software/tools: Experience with big data tools: Hadoop, Hive, Kafka, ELK (ECE), etc. Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases such as MSSQL, Postgres, Cassandra, MongoDB, TimeScaleDB Experience with mission-critical production development in following languages and frameworks a plus Languages: Java, Python, Web (HTML5, CSS, JS, XML, TS), Golang, VBA Frameworks: Angular, .NET, SciKitLearn, SciPy, NumPy, etc Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools: Airflow, Apache NiFi, Redis, Microsoft Office, Sharepoint, etc Experience with Azure cloud services: Blob Storage, Power BI, Logic Apps, Flow Apps, MSSQL Data Warehouse Experience with stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark, etc. Experience in Microsoft PowerBI implementation (Custom components, DAX, M) Additional Info: This is on 12 months contract basis Interested candidates must be open to work in the West To apply, please visit www.gmprecruit.com and search for Job Reference: 16057 To learn more about this opportunity, please contact Yingying at We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Title: API Development Specialist
Description:
Job: Technology
Primary Location: ASEAN & South Asia-Singapore-Singapore
Schedule: Full-time
Employee Status: Permanent
Posting Date: 04/May/2020
Unposting Date: 24/Jun/2020
About Standard Chartered
We are a leading international bank focused on helping people and companies prosper across Asia, Africa and the Middle East.


To us, good performance is about much more than turning a profit. It's about showing how you embody our valued behaviours - do the right thing, better together and never settle - as well as our brand promise, Here for good.


We're committed to promoting equality in the workplace and creating an inclusive and flexible culture - one where everyone can realise their full potential and make a positive contribution to our organisation. This in turn helps us to provide better support to our broad client base.


Job Purpose

Standard Chartered Bank is looking for a specialist API developer to join a team of engineers focused on the development of world-class digital products. Our team builds externally facing API portal and enhance the customer experience at our Bank. You will be working with an international team of engineers, UX and UI designers, and senior business leaders.

You would own the technical implementation of API portal front end development and provide mentorship and guidance for our team. In this role, you would be expected to participate in discussions and planning around software architecture and enterprise platform integrations. You would work closely with the UX and UI teams to take innovative solutions from concept to prototyping to production.

The ideal candidate is open-minded, a team player, and excited by fresh challenges in an innovative working environment. You would gain valuable work experience through direct collaboration with senior level engineers and designers who have backgrounds in the top Silicon Valley technology companies.

The Role Responsibilities
Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software aspects of API portal
Responsible for development of API portal that is used by external clients, partners and third parties.
Validating that APIs published on the portal meet the banks standards
Create a user experience unique and market leading
Enhance portal with sandbox, analytics, self-service onboarding
Interact with UX and backend Java developers
Interact and manage business and tech stakeholders from other teams.
Our Ideal Candidate


Minimum Qualifications
Degree in Computer Science
7+ years experience
Strong experience with JavaScript(ReactJS React-Redux, nodeJS, Gatsby), TypeScript, Python.
SQL, no-SQL DB experience (MongoDb preferred)
Experience in working with other front end technologies and frameworks.
Must have experience developing API portals with rich features
Must have experience validating API standards
Excellent verbal and written communication, and presentation skills in English
Preferred Qualifications
Background in computer science, with a focus on data structures, data modelling, algorithms, API design, microservices.
Gatsby, GraphQL
Working with strong UX team
Ability to learn other coding languages.
Demonstrated ability to share knowledge via formal mentoring, reviewing code, reviewing design documents
Apply now to join the Bank for those with big career ambitions.

Title: Director of Product (Partner Experience), APAC
Description:
At foodpanda we're on a mission to redefine how tech, food, people and culture are connected operating in 12 countries worldwide. Our team is working on big challenges and complex scalability problems as we grow 6X annually processing millions of orders a year. You'll be part of a highly collaborative cross-functional agile squad that always includes frontend and backend engineers, design and product owners. Our squads operate in an open and fast-paced environment with very flat structures where everyone has a say.
We work on a large scale, complex systems where you can reach users on a global scale whilst enjoying a high level of autonomy and influence and a flexible working environment. Here you can learn, thrive and become a better engineer, designer and product manager.
Director of Product (Partner Experience), APAC
We are looking for a Director of Product to lead one of our tribes in Singapore. As a Director you will be responsible and accountable to define and deliver features that contribute to the growth of Restaurant Partner Services vertical across different markets.You'll define the value propositions, product Vision & strategy, go to market and KPIs we should focus on to make our Restaurant Partner's lives better and to grow foodpanda business.
You will work closely with engineers, product management and user experience designers to build best-in-class services and apps. You will liaise with other product management and leadership teams and work closely with business development, marketing, finance, legal to get feedback from partners ,customers and international teams to define and build product requirements in order to grow the business.
You will be helping in building an organization based on smart people, diversity, and individuals with a "can-do" attitude that want to build apps and services used daily by foodpanda customers and vendors worldwide.
What's on the menu:
Set the vision and strategy for foodpanda verticals with our executive and engineering teams.
You will directly manage a tribe and 8+ Products and Product managers who are focused on Partner service products
Execute a robust and comprehensive strategy, product roadmap, and business plan for foodpanda business
Define the roadmap, business requirements, measures of success, and features for your products and services, and work with your PM team to drive and deliver these to market.
Identify and execute on opportunities to drive up engagement for users
Grow revenue directly attributable to value created within foodpanda verticals
Operate strong feedback loops, identify and drive measurements, and creatively use data sources to craft better experiences and ensure we are building the right products over time.
Collaborate with marketing, business development, design, engineering, analytics, and other product managers to drive our business with meaningful value to our user base and to ensure alignment with Product strategy
Drive highly visible and impactful decisions for your area.
Keep apprised of new innovations and trends in the industry
What you can bring to the table:
10+ years of experience building complex software or application platforms (Mobile + Web)
5+ years experience in complex e-commerce product
7+ years in product management
7+ years managing organizations while still remaining hands-on to the details
5+ years directly managing product managers
Willing to take action and ambitious with ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic atmosphere
Thrive between the balance of customer experience and commercial needs
Able to deal with ambiguity and be able to break down barriers
Ability to balance priorities and multi-task
Experience in presenting to senior management and building consensus
Turn business requirements into a road map of features broken down by quarter
Maintain a prioritized backlog with clear and concise user stories
Sound product and execution skills and ability to perform under tight deadlines
Able to be very detailed while keeping an eye on the big picture
Define key requirements and go deep on the details as needed
Be the SME for the feature(s) / product you are driving
Develop metrics and reporting for features
Understand the systems and technologies behind your product, their limitations, scaling factors, boundary conditions, and reasons for architectural decisions.
Drive alignment across program and technology teams to deliver on stakeholder needs.
Experience in building platform solutions, defining services and applications
About foodpanda
foodpanda (small 'f') is the world's favourite way to order food online from the comfort of your home or office. Whether it's getting your hands on your favourite pasta, kebab or pizza, we believe that no one should have to suffer from hunger attacks ever again.
Our parent company, Delivery Hero, is a global leader in the food delivery industry processing over 3 million orders every day and operating in 40+ markets in the world, with 18,000 employees and approximately 500,000+ restaurant partners. In APAC, foodpanda operates in over 150 cities across 12 countries. Trivial problems can always become large technical challenges at scale. If you love technology, efficiency and simplicity as much as we do, there is no better place to experience this than in foodpanda.
We always genuinely care about experience, efficiency and scalability. We do not just solve technical problems but build the foundations for foodpanda's operations with the best tools on hand.
