Title: #SGUNITEDJOBS APPLICATION DEVELOPER
Description:
Roles and Responsibilities:
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements. Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, redesigning infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and ‘big data’ technologies
Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics.
Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs.
Keep our data separated and secure through multiple data centres.
Create data tools for analytics team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader.
Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems.
Requirements:
Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational and columnar databases and database partitioning.
Preferably with experience building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures and data sets.
Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business
questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
A successful history of manipulating, processing and extracting value from large disconnected datasets.
Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable ‘big data’ data stores.
We are looking for a candidate with 5+ years of experience in a Data Engineer role, who has attained a Graduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field.
Preferably with the experience of using the following software/tools:
Experience with big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, RabbitMQ etc.
Experience with NoSQL/New SQL databases.
Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban, Luigi, Airflow, etc.
a) Experience with AWS cloud services: EC2, EMR, RDS, Redshift
b) Experience with stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark-Streaming, etc.
c) Experience with either of these languages: Python, Java.

Title: SAS Engineer
Description:
We are looking for 2 SAS engineers for 3 to 6 months (potentially extended to 1 to 2 years) , who has good data project knowledge with strong experience in SAS along with good Hadoop knowledge.

JD as below;

Requirements:
Preferably 3-5 years of application development experience with strong knowledge in SAS programming and Enterprise Guide
Sound knowledge in SQL and any other programming knowledge is essential.
Sound knowledge of data architecture and data warehouse system in Big data and Teradata would be good to have
Strong problem-solving skills and an ability to prioritise and manage multiple tasks.
Strong team player with good communication skills and able to work with multiple stakeholders including senior managers.
Good knowledge in Microsoft EXCEL, Word and Powerpoint
Excellent SAS and advanced programming skills like Spark and Python
Experience working with large and complex SAS datasets
Strong in SAS tools to understand the existing code and document the requirements.
Ability to reverse engineer SAS code to business requirement
Job responsibilities:
The successful candidate will work as part of CBG Customer management and Analytics team team and is expected to:
Work with the CBG Business analyst team to understand the SAS code logic. Document existing SAS Code logic in word/excel and document the lineage.
Understand SAS-codes written by techno-functional users and write the relevant document in work/excel which depict the exact requirement.
Generate the macros necessary to capture the audit trail (job start time, end time, number of records processed, user who trigger the run etc.) of job execution in a tabular format.
Perform unit testing and system integration testing.
Work closely with Business team to document all the requirement.
Prepare necessary design/operations documentation for future usage.
Map the SAS dataset attributes with existing Integrated model from Data lake.

Title: Senior VP, Advanced Threat Research, Group Information Secur...
Description:
About UOBUnited Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.About the DepartmentThe Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches.Job Responsibilities
Provide direct leadership, management, and operational oversight for our Level 3 engineers as well as execution of enhanced cyber security capabilities build-up programs.
Responsible for engineering design and development of cyber security technology along with integration of new architectural features into existing infrastructures while maintaining the integrity and security of enterprise-wide cyber security systems and networks.
Provide technical and security expertise to IT and business leadership and technical teams to identify cost-effective and appropriate security technology solutions and develop security reference architectures and strategies to achieve business results.
Develop/integrate cyber security solutions with multi-level security requirements for enhanced monitoring and detection capability
Maintain awareness of trends and issues in area of security expertise, evaluate new security technologies opportunities, and provide analysis of their potential advantage to the business.

Others:
Perform as a member of the Cyber security capability enhancement team to drive or participate in product evaluation, project discussion and deployments
Work within established practices and handling guidelines to develop and deploy preventive maintenance processes for GSOC infrastructure
Work with internal technical teams and engineers in technical troubleshooting, exercises and forums
Available to respond to client requests and assist with troubleshooting activities
Able to resolve customer related issues with minimal guidance
Communicate effectively with a variety of internal teams and external contacts including technical and executive contacts
Capable of juggling variety of priorities and deliverables in an interrupt driven environment with minimal guidance or supervision

Job Requirements

Education

Preferred Degree in engineering/Computer Science / IT/Cyber Security from a recognized education institution
Professional security related qualification (e.g. SANS GCIA, GCIH etc.) is favorable

Technical Skills and experience

Min 10-15 years of relevant Cyber security experience
Expert knowledge in networking technology and network security (i.e. Firewalls, WAF, IDS, IPS, VPN, HIPS, ADS, SIEM, UBA and TCP/IP protocols)
Minimum 5 years of relevant working experience in a SOC environment and leading a team of highly skilled Cyber Engineers
Familiar with SOC processes
Understanding of threat response and incident response
Understanding in Unix/Linux and Windows administration
Understanding in Security Information Event Management System (SIEMS) example: HP ArcSight / Splunk
Strong foundation in security threat TTPs and attack counter measure
Analytical problem solver and good at troubleshooting technical issues
Effective time management and organizational skills
Operational knowledge of SIEMS, Breach Detection System, Network Forensic System, Big Data analytics, User Behavior Analytics and endpoint security technology
Understanding of malware analysis platforms and tools
Understanding of threat intelligence platforms and tools
Technical/logical understanding of FW/IDS/IPS/WAF rule and SIEM rule construction
Programming, concepts and scripting languages – Python, Ruby, Power-shell, Java, C/C++, Regex, STIX
Good understanding of network forensics and packet analysis
Good understanding of SQL/Database, SOAP-XML, Restful API
Good understanding of internet concepts and technologies – internet services, search engines, open source tools, android/iOS - mobile technology, LAMP, iOT, TOR etc.

Soft Skills

Good written and verbal communication skills
Process and procedure adherence
Strong analytical and problem solving skill

Be a part of UOB FamilyApply now and make a difference.

Title: Lead Data Engineer (Hadoop / Python / MatLab)
Description:
Opportunity to work with Advanced Technologies
High Impact Position
About Our Client
Our client is an upcoming Technology Platform and they are looking for a highly motivated Lead Data Engineer (Hadoop / Python / MatLab) to work with a diverse team of technical resources, product managers and develop advanced technology solutions.
Job Description
As the Lead Data Engineer (Hadoop / Python / MatLab), you are responsible for:
Identifying, reviewing, and determining the value of unstructured data from multiple sources before designing scalable systems to ingest the relevant data.
Developing the blueprint design for the data architecture on cloud platforms, ensuring scalability and efficiency.
Owning the data pipelines and driving continuous improvements in data quality reports.
Designing data models to support analytics reports, data transformation and data science models.
Collaborating with Industry Experts and Software Engineers to refine the selection of data sources and optimize the data collection process.
The Successful Applicant
As a successful applicant, you will have a Degree in Business Analytics or equivalent with at least 5 years of experience in the Data Engineering field, backed by strong working experience with both unstructured and structured data. You will also have a proven track record of working with Big Data tools such as Hadoop / Spark / Hive, coupled with relevant scripting experience using Python with NoSQL databases such as MongoDB / PostgreSQL.
You will have a strong experience with statistical programming tools such as MatLab / R / SAS in a UNIX / LINUX environment. You will also have relevant experience with data modelling and creating predictive models.

Title: #SGUNITEDJOBS TECHNICAL SUPPORT ENGINEER
Description:
About the Department
The Cloudflare Customer Support Team solves complicated problems and answers technical questions via phone, email, chat and social media. Whether it is a Wordpress blogger using our services for free or a global Enterprise business with petabytes of web traffic, we are always eager to assist. We are the eyes and ears of Cloudflare, acting as the real-time voice of the customer to help communicate their needs and real-world use cases back to the rest of the company - for better service and future product development.
What You'll Do
Do you like solving complex problems? Are you an analytical thinker with a knack for non-linear logic? Do you enjoy interacting with people?
We are seeking a Technical Customer Support Engineer to join our team. You will work with our users on complicated technical support issues as well as the Technical Operations team that is responsible for running our global, distributed network. You will also build system security tools including writing web security firewall rules and build big data analytics tools. This is a position where you will learn the inner workings of Cloudflare's technology, while also getting to work directly with our customers, particularly in the APAC region.
Examples of desirable skills, knowledge and experience
2+ years of customer-facing technical support experience
Extensive experience troubleshooting DNS and networking-related issues
Familiarity with Linux and web programming
Understanding of DNS and how the Internet works
Experience with Apache, Nginx, IIS, and other web servers
You live at the command line, and only use a GUI when you have no other choice
You know that a curl isn't necessarily related to weightlifting or an Olympic sport
Experience working in a support role where you thrived every time you resolved a ticket
Strong communication skills that allow you to be a bridge between customers and the engineering team
Bonus Points
B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent
Experience with PostgreSQL, MySQL, MS SQL, and other database servers
Experience with popular blogging platforms, forum software, and/or CRM software
Interest in web security
You have worked at a hosting company or a web development company

Title: Lead Consultant
Description:
Role Summary
You will be responsible for building the business' data collection systems and processing highly available data pipelines that facilitate deeper analysis and reporting by the business users. You will also be building data processing frameworks that handle the business's growing database and will work with the business users in leveraging data with reporting and scientific tools. In addition, you will strive to continuously develop new and improved data engineering capabilities.

Job Responsibilities
Implement strategies directed at acquiring data and promoting the development of new insights across the business. You will own and extend the business's data pipeline through the collection, storage, processing, and transformation of large data-sets.
Monitor the existing metrics, analyze data, and work with business users to identify and implement system and process improvements.
Develop queries for ad hoc business projects, as well as ongoing reporting. In this capacity, you will build a metadata system where all available data is maintained and catalogued. You will also play a major role in the development of reliable data pipelines that translate raw data into powerful features and signals.
Designs, architects, implements, and supports key datasets that avail structured and timely access to actionable business insights. You will also be responsible with developing ETL processes that convert data into formats through dashboard charts.
Work closely with the business users in gathering requirements for data governance across the department and the business at large.
Apply best practices as well as defining the business's data requirements, which will ensure that the collected data is of a high quality and optimal for use across the departments and business at large.
Analyze and understand data sources, participating in design, and providing insights and guidance on database technology and data modelling best practices.
Develop and manage scalable data processing platforms that will be used for exploratory data analysis and real-time analytics. You will oversee, design, and develop algorithms for real-time data processing within the business and to create the frameworks that enable quick and efficient data acquisition.
Retrieve and analyze data using SQL, Excel among other data management systems. You will also build data loading services for importing data from numerous disparate data sources, inclusive of APIs, logs, relational, and non-relational databases.
Contribute to the continual improvement of the business's data platforms.
Job Requirements
Degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, Information Technology or related fields.

Title: Data Engineering Manager
Description:
Do you like working with big data? Do you like growing a team from the beginning and establishing the Data Engineering function in Singapore? If yes, we in Ads group want to talk to you. As the first Manager for Data Engineering in Singapore for the Ads and Business Platform (ABP) pillar, you will be key in managing the existing data engineers and growing the function in Singapore This is your opportunity to shape the culture of a growing function in Singapore, in line with the company values and create a high performing team of Data Engineers. This is also an opportunity to get exposed to a broad range of products that the Singapore location supports, and create impact by discovering analytics gaps and blind spots for those products along with improving them. Whether you are a seasoned leader or someone who has been in leadership for a short period, this is a role that will allow you to start with a small team, allowing time to get a deep understanding along with an opportunity to take on a bigger leadership role over time. The perfect candidate will have strong data infrastructure and data architecture skills, a proven track record of leading and scaling data teams, strong operational skills to drive efficiency and speed, strong project management leadership, and a strong vision for how data engineering can proactively create positive impact for companies. This is a full-time position based in our Singapore office.
Data Engineering Manager Responsibilities
Proactively drive the vision for data engineering across product verticals in Singapore, and define and execute on a plan to achieve that vision.
Build a high-quality data engineering team and design the team to scale.
Build cross-functional relationships with Data Scientists, Product Managers and Software Engineers to understand data needs and deliver on those needs.
Drive the design, building, and launching of new data models and data pipelines in production.
Manage development of data resources and support new product launches.
Drive data quality across the product vertical and related business areas.
Manage the delivery of high impact dashboards and data visualisations.
Define and manage SLA’s for all data sets and processes running in production.
Minimum Qualifications
6+ years of experience in Data Engineering, BI or Data Warehousing.
Experience scaling and managing 3+ person teams.
Communication and leadership experience, with experience initiating and driving projects.
Experience in SQL or similar languages and development experience in at least one scripting language (Python, Perl, etc.).
Project management experience.
Data architecture experience.
BA/BS in Computer Science, Math, Physics, or other technical fields.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience in a consumer web or mobile company.
Experience with data sets, Hive, and data visualization tools.
Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities — we're just getting started.
Facebook is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

Title: Market Data Technical Project Manager - Exchange Data & Busi...
Description:
Apply Now
You're on the pulse with market movements and live for the details beyond the headlines. You love to build relationships and always look to provide excellent customer service. As a natural problem solver, you thrive with building innovative solutions to sophisticated problems.
The Role
Bloomberg's Content & Entities Business Management team (CEBM) is seeking a Market Data Technical Project Manager to join our team. For this role, we are looking for an outstanding professional who has a mixture of strong analytical, project management, and technology skills and an ability to bring an ambitious vision to our Exchanges team. The Exchanges team supports over 350 trading venues globally and is constantly looking to improve our technical capabilities to effectively manage our market leading exchange content.

Market Data Technical Project Managers are responsible for formulating and delivering end-to-end technology solutions in line with strategic business objectives. They understand how market data is used by various Bloomberg products and customers and can collaborate with internal and external partners to implement enterprise wide initiatives. They are highly analytical individuals who can innovate and deliver in a multifaceted and constantly evolving, technical environment.

We'll trust you to:
Leverage your experience in the financial industry and understanding of market data and technology to develop strategies to influence and direct the strategic direction of Bloomberg's exchange infrastructure. You'll not only excel in running day-to-day projects but you'll also keep an eye on the big picture and won't be afraid to upend existing systems and processes if need be. You'll periodically review the alignment of our technology with the business strategy and drive initiatives to constantly raise the bar of our capabilities to acquire and handle exchange content.
How you will make an impact:
Champion projects sought to transform Bloomberg's technical and business capabilities to run exchange services
Build and lead the plans for moving technical solutions to production
Leverage your strong analytic abilities to devise innovative market data technology solutions to influence the future direction of Bloomberg's infrastructure
Assist with solving technical problems when they arise
Build relationships with internal and external partners to understand their business needs; build consensus and strategies to deliver on those needs
Proactively manage changes in project scope, identify potential risks and devise contingency plans
Effectively communicate progress and success to partners in compelling, creative, and accessible ways
Develop and deliver reports & requirements documentation
Build rapport with programmers - keep them focused and projects moving
You'll need to have:
Expertise with how market data is used by different products and customers
7+ years of industry experience, with a passion for leading projects involving new technology
Experience leading financial technology projects involving teams of Engineers
A desire to increase knowledge of software, network architecture and low latency parsers and systems
Understanding of one or more technical languages; eg Ruby or Python, JAVA or C++ (hands-on coding experience not necessary)
Ability to discuss deep technical concepts, evaluate trade-offs and devise innovative solutions with engineers
Understanding of financial markets and the exchange market data industry
Strong analytical and quantitative skills; ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions and recommendations
Experience leading cross-organizational teams and ability to work closely with engineers to deliver on aggressive schedules
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Problem solving aptitude
We'd love to see:
Demonstrated interest in programming
Exposure to agile software development methodologies
Business proficiency in Mandarin
Does this sound like you?
Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know what the next steps are!
Bloomberg is a disability inclusive employer. Please let us know if you require any adjustments to be made for the recruitment process by emailing access2@bloomberg.net.
Apply Now

Title: Senior VP, Advanced Threat Research, Group Information Secur...
Description:
About UOBUnited Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.About the DepartmentThe Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches.Job Responsibilities
Provide direct leadership, management, and operational oversight for our Level 3 engineers as well as execution of enhanced cyber security capabilities build-up programs.
Responsible for engineering design and development of cyber security technology along with integration of new architectural features into existing infrastructures while maintaining the integrity and security of enterprise-wide cyber security systems and networks.
Provide technical and security expertise to IT and business leadership and technical teams to identify cost-effective and appropriate security technology solutions and develop security reference architectures and strategies to achieve business results.
Develop/integrate cyber security solutions with multi-level security requirements for enhanced monitoring and detection capability
Maintain awareness of trends and issues in area of security expertise, evaluate new security technologies opportunities, and provide analysis of their potential advantage to the business.

Others:
Perform as a member of the Cyber security capability enhancement team to drive or participate in product evaluation, project discussion and deployments
Work within established practices and handling guidelines to develop and deploy preventive maintenance processes for GSOC infrastructure
Work with internal technical teams and engineers in technical troubleshooting, exercises and forums
Available to respond to client requests and assist with troubleshooting activities
Able to resolve customer related issues with minimal guidance
Communicate effectively with a variety of internal teams and external contacts including technical and executive contacts
Capable of juggling variety of priorities and deliverables in an interrupt driven environment with minimal guidance or supervision

Job Requirements

Education

Preferred Degree in engineering/Computer Science / IT/Cyber Security from a recognized education institution
Professional security related qualification (e.g. SANS GCIA, GCIH etc.) is favorable

Technical Skills and experience

Min 10-15 years of relevant Cyber security experience
Expert knowledge in networking technology and network security (i.e. Firewalls, WAF, IDS, IPS, VPN, HIPS, ADS, SIEM, UBA and TCP/IP protocols)
Minimum 5 years of relevant working experience in a SOC environment and leading a team of highly skilled Cyber Engineers
Familiar with SOC processes
Understanding of threat response and incident response
Understanding in Unix/Linux and Windows administration
Understanding in Security Information Event Management System (SIEMS) example: HP ArcSight / Splunk
Strong foundation in security threat TTPs and attack counter measure
Analytical problem solver and good at troubleshooting technical issues
Effective time management and organizational skills
Operational knowledge of SIEMS, Breach Detection System, Network Forensic System, Big Data analytics, User Behavior Analytics and endpoint security technology
Understanding of malware analysis platforms and tools
Understanding of threat intelligence platforms and tools
Technical/logical understanding of FW/IDS/IPS/WAF rule and SIEM rule construction
Programming, concepts and scripting languages – Python, Ruby, Power-shell, Java, C/C++, Regex, STIX
Good understanding of network forensics and packet analysis
Good understanding of SQL/Database, SOAP-XML, Restful API
Good understanding of internet concepts and technologies – internet services, search engines, open source tools, android/iOS - mobile technology, LAMP, iOT, TOR etc.

Soft Skills

Good written and verbal communication skills
Process and procedure adherence
Strong analytical and problem solving skill

Be a part of UOB FamilyApply now and make a difference.

Title: Senior Solution Engineer, ASEAN - Oracle Digital Prime
Description:
Senior Solution Engineer, ASEAN - Oracle Digital Prime-20000EAU

Applicants are required to read, write, and speak the following languages: English
Preferred Qualifications

The role of the Senior Solution Engineer is to successfully engage, position and secure the technical selection of Oracle’s on-prem and cloud solutions. You are expected to work closely with the sales and product teams, own the solution opportunity from a technical perspective, engage continually with customers and drive the opportunity to sales closure. In doing this, you build a trusted advisor relationship with key customer executives, evaluation team members and decision makers.
This is an ASEAN role with a huge focus on Cloud (IaaS & PaaS) and DevOps technologies.

The responsibilities related to this role are listed below:
Formulate and lead the Hybrid Cloud solutioning engagement with potential and existing customers
Lead presales technical/functional support activity to prospective clients and customers; Develop and deliver outstanding presentations and demonstrations
RFP/RFI responses, sizing and capacity estimation, cost benefit analysis derivation
Be creative with strong problem solving skills and the ability to adapt and succeed in a fast paced and continuously evolving
Coach/advise the sales teams on effective ways of dealing with competitive traps and objection handling
Build / leverage assets that help simplify available information into key sales messages helping sales teams with value based selling, business case definition, ROI analysis, position references and analyst data
Actively participate in organizational skill exchanges and transfers expertise to others.
Design/ leverage and implement programs that result in adequate pipeline to ensure over-achievement of regional sales targets
Continuous improvement in self-research, learning and readiness on the new public and Hybrid cloud services offerings
Stay abreast of global and regional cloud and on-prem landscape and the competition
Extend and enlarge the knowledge base of the domain of expertise by defining new approaches, by coaching others and by leadership in their professional communities internally and externally
Drive activities to increase awareness, demand and adoption of Oracle Hybrid Cloud portfolio of services and products
Working with Oracle’s Consulting organizations and partners to proactively ensure on time and budget implementation of positioned solution

REQUIRED SKILLS/EXPERIENCE
More than 8 years of experience in the IT industry, of which at least 5 hands-on experience is a must
Hands-on experience in Cloud Infra modernization with Lift & Shift
Hands-on experience with DevOps, CI/CD, Kubernetes, Container, Serverless/Function
Software development background with agile development experience
Require hands-on experience in Oracle database, from the perspective of AWR analysis & performance tunning, database backup & recovery, database high availability configuration and management, disaster recovery, database security & database options
Require hands-on experience in data analytics, data integration, busiless intellegent, data warehousing design & development, preferable with Oracle data management technologies
Require experience in designing & deploying solutions on cloud, using Infrastrucutre and Platform cloud services (IaaS and PaaS), preferable with Oracle cloud
Hands-on experience in big data technologies, and event steaming is an added advantage
Experience in software application development using cloud naitve technologies, and agile development methodlogy, is an added advantage
Experience with middleware technology stack, such as App Server high availability, SOA, ESB, Service Integration, API management, and Identity management, is an added advantage
Great presentation and communication skill, is a must

Detailed Description and Job Requirements
The primary focus of a Sales Consultant (Pre-sales) is to become an expert in a core set of Oracle products and solutions and to present the value proposition and benefits of our solutions to our partners, prospects and customers and internally to our sales force

As a Senior Sales Consultant you will be responsible for providing presales technical / functional support to prospective clients and customers while ensuring customer satisfaction with minimal supervision, through on-line/in person sales efforts. Acts as a technical resource for less experienced Internet Sales Consultants. Develop and deliver high quality standard Oracle presentations and demonstrations. Present and articulate advanced product features and benefits, product future direction and overall Oracle solutions. Design, validate, and present Oracle software solutions to include advanced product concepts, future direction, and 3rd party complimentary products. Develop and manage reference sites through high quality technical, professional client relationships. Support sales team in online/in-person selling efforts with minimal supervision. Develop and deliver proposed solution to customers. Approximate percentage of face to face interaction with customers to perform responsibilities is 10%

Job duties are varied and complex, needing independent judgment. May have project lead role. 5 years vendor (sales and marketing) experience. 5 years relevant computer applications or database/tools. Demonstrated proficiency in one multi-user operating system. Through knowledge of system and application design. Strong verbal and written communication skills: needs analysis, positioning, business justification, closing techniques. Demonstrated ability to solve complex technical problems with accounts in complex technical environments. Ability to travel as needed. BS degree or equivalent; advanced degree desirable.

Title: #SGUNITEDJOBS DEVOPS ENGINEER
Description:
Our Client
Familiar brand in public sector industry.
12 months contract with an option to extend
Attractive contract package and benefits (18 days AL, performance bonus, transportation allowance, training opportunities and etc.)
The Opportunity
Part of the project Enterprise Information Management team to take on the exciting and challenging role of delivering and maintaining an agency-wide datawarehouse and analytics project using AGILE software development methodology.
Provide production support and operation for the system during office hours or as and when required after office hours or on weekends for scheduled maintenance and deployments
Work with the team to support existing system and integration of new components in the system
Maintain existing infrastructure which includes Windows-based servers, SQL databases, Power BI, Sharepoint, SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS), SQL Server Analytics Services (SSAS), SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) and R.
Plan, design, build and maintain development environment which includes SSIS, .net, Visual basic, SSMS, etc.
Participate in planning, evaluation, building and maintaining new big data infrastructure and development platform for analytics and data science
Develop automation code for deployment and maintenance of infrastructure and applications
Perform automated deployments to existing or new infrastructure environments
Build continuous integration and delivery pipeline for applications
Liaise with 3rd party software, hardware and application vendors to manage and resolve incidents and technical issues
Your Background

1. Tertiary Education in relevant fields is preferred
2. DBA Certified, preferably MS SQL Certified DBA or equivalent with 5 years extensive experience in databases (design, implementation, administration and support).
3. Hands on experience in Microsoft technologies, preferably for Business Intelligence and data management using tools such as Microsoft SQL SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, Power Bi, R, Sharepoint, and Team Foundation Studio.
4. Experience in one or more of the following will be an added advantage:
a) Virtualisation (VMWare VSphere family of products) and container technology
b) Secure code review, Automated Testing
c) Big Data platform (Hadoop), Git
d) Scripting languages (e.g. Python)
e) Dot Net programming
f) Agile continuous integration tools
5. Good team player
6. Passionate in championing the team to continuously improve and deliver quality software product
7. Experience in use of CI/CD preferred.
8. Experience in setup of CI/CD tools and upgrades of Microsoft BI stack is preferred.

Interested candidates please submit your CV to mayanne.ramos@peoplebank.asia or apply online.

Title: Lead Data Engineer (Hadoop / Python / MatLab)
Description:
Opportunity to work with Advanced Technologies
High Impact Position
About Our Client
Our client is an upcoming Technology Platform and they are looking for a highly motivated Lead Data Engineer (Hadoop / Python / MatLab) to work with a diverse team of technical resources, product managers and develop advanced technology solutions.
Job Description
As the Lead Data Engineer (Hadoop / Python / MatLab), you are responsible for:
Identifying, reviewing, and determining the value of unstructured data from multiple sources before designing scalable systems to ingest the relevant data.
Developing the blueprint design for the data architecture on cloud platforms, ensuring scalability and efficiency.
Owning the data pipelines and driving continuous improvements in data quality reports.
Designing data models to support analytics reports, data transformation and data science models.
Collaborating with Industry Experts and Software Engineers to refine the selection of data sources and optimize the data collection process.
The Successful Applicant
As a successful applicant, you will have a Degree in Business Analytics or equivalent with at least 5 years of experience in the Data Engineering field, backed by strong working experience with both unstructured and structured data. You will also have a proven track record of working with Big Data tools such as Hadoop / Spark / Hive, coupled with relevant scripting experience using Python with NoSQL databases such as MongoDB / PostgreSQL.
You will have a strong experience with statistical programming tools such as MatLab / R / SAS in a UNIX / LINUX environment. You will also have relevant experience with data modelling and creating predictive models.

Opportunity to work with Advanced Technologies
High Impact Position
Attractive Salary Package

Title: Senior Data Engineer
Description:
We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer to work in Tokyo, Japan who is excited to build the next-generation data processing that can handle large scale workloads. The right candidate has a solid background in setting up complex and scalable CI pipelines and a good understanding of Machine Learning.
RESPONSIBILITY
・Maintain and continuously improve large scale iterative labelling, experimenting, training, and deploying processing pipelines for modern deep learning on cameras, LiDARs, radars, and other sensor data.
・Communicate, scope and design new features to meet the needs of clients inside and outside of the company
・Develop and integrate data handling tools and work with teams to provide ground-truth in support of machine learning and simulation.
・Live and breathe the software practices that produce maintainable code, including automated testing, continuous integration, code style conformity, and code review.

TECHNICAL QUALIFICATIONS
Software engineering
・Service oriented architecture
・Microservices
・Experience with devtools: Jira, Github, Gitlab, Jenkins, Artifactory
・Experience with building, owning, managing and operating data platforms

Infrastructure
・Infrastructure as Code: Terraform
・Containers: Docker
・AWS experience including:
・・・Compute: EC2, ECS, EKS, Lambda, Batch
・・・Storage: S3
・・・Database: DynamoDB, Redshift
・・・Networking: API Gateway
・・・Security / Identity: IAM, Cognito
・・・Application Integration: Step functions, SQS, SNS
・Big Data / Analytics: Glue, EMR, Athena, Kinesis, ElasticSearch, Quicksight, Spark

Data
We require experience with one of the following:
・Computer vision and image processing
・Sensor processing and fusion
・Time series data processing
・Deep learning frameworks and building software on top of these frameworks such as PyTorch and Tensorflow

Soft Skills
・Excellent communication and organization skills
・Business level English

Title: Specialist SA, Machine Learning
Description:
3+ years of experience in design/implementation/consulting for Machine Learning/AI/Deep Learning solutions
3+ years of experience with one or more Deep Learning frameworks such as Apache MXNet, TensorFlow, Caffe2, Keras, Microsoft Cognitive Toolkit, Torch and Theano
5+ years professional experience in software development in languages related to ML like Python or R. Experience working with RESTful API and general service-oriented architectures
3+ years of experience in technical architecture, design, deployment and operations for AI platforms, standards, protocols and devices

Are you passionate about Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and Deep Learning? Are you passionate about helping customers build solutions leveraging the state-of-the-art AI/ML/DL tools on Amazon Web Service (AWS)?

Come join us!

At Amazon, we’ve been investing deeply in artificial intelligence for over 20 years, and many of the capabilities customers experience are driven by machine learning. Amazon.com’s recommendations engine is driven by machine learning (ML), as are the paths that optimise robotic picking routes in our fulfilment centres. Our supply chain, forecasting, and capacity planning are also informed by ML algorithms. Alexa is fueled by Natural Language Understanding and Automated Speech Recognition deep learning; as is Prime Air, and the computer vision technology in our new retail experience, Amazon Go. We have thousands of engineers at Amazon committed to machine learning and deep learning, and it’s a big part of our heritage.

Within AWS, we’re focused on bringing that knowledge and capability to customers through three layers of the AI stack:
1) Frameworks and Infrastructure with tools like Apache MxNet and TensorFlow,
2) Machine Learning Platforms such as Amazon SageMaker for data scientists and
3) API-driven Services like Amazon Lex, Amazon Polly, Amazon Transcribe, Amazon Comprehend, and Amazon Rekognition to quickly add intelligence to applications with a simple API call.

AWS is looking for a Machine Learning Solutions Architect (ML SA), who will be the Subject Matter Expert (SME) for helping customers in ASEAN design solutions that leverage our ML services. As part of the team, you will work closely with customers to enable large-scale use cases, design ML pipelines, and drive the adoption of AWS for the ML/AI platforms. You will interact with other SAs in the field, providing guidance on their customer engagements, and you will develop white papers, blogs, reference implementations, and presentations to enable customers to fully leverage ML/AI on AWS. Additionally, as the voice of the customer, you will work closely with the service teams, and submit product feature requests to drive the platform forward.

You must have deep technical experience working with technologies related to artificial intelligence, machine learning and/or deep learning. A strong mathematics and statistics background is preferred in addition to experience building complex machine learning models. You will be familiar with the ecosystem of software vendors in the AI/ML space, and will leverage this knowledge to help AWS customers in their selection process.

Your roles and responsibilities will include:
Work with customers’ development and data science teams to deeply understand their business and technical needs and design ML solutions that make the best use of AWS SageMaker, the AWS AI Services and the AWS cloud platform.
Thought Leadership – Evangelise AWS ML services and share best practices through forums such as AWS blogs, whitepapers, reference architectures and public-speaking events such as AWS Singapore Summit, AWS re:Invent, etc.
Partner with SAs, Sales, Business Development and the AI/ML Service teams to accelerate customer adoption and revenue attainment in ASEAN of Amazon SageMaker.
Act as a technical liaison between customers and the AWS SageMaker services teams to provide customer driven product improvement feedback.
Contribute to the development and support of an AWS internal community of ML related subject matter experts.

Graduate degree in a highly quantitative field (Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operations Research, Statistics, Mathematics, etc.)
· 5+ years of industry experience in predictive modeling and analysis · Ability to develop experimental and analytic plans for data modeling processes, use of strong baselines, ability to accurately determine cause and effect relationships
Consulting experience and track record of helping customers with their AI needs
Publications or presentation in recognised Machine Learning, Deep Learning and Data Mining journals/conferences
Experience with AWS technologies like Sagemaker, Redshift, S3, EC2, Data Pipeline, Kinesis & EMR
Knowledge of SparkML
Able to write production level code, which is well-written and explainable
Experience using ML libraries, such as scikit-learn, caret, mlr, mllib
Experience working with GPUs to develop models
Experience handling terabyte size datasets
Track record of diving into data to discover hidden patterns
Familiarity with using data visualisation tools
Knowledge and experience of writing and tuning SQL
Past and current experience writing and speaking about complex technical concepts to broad audiences in a simplified format
Experience giving data presentations
Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Do you want to change the world? Imagine what you could do here at Apple! Title: Global Head of Solutions (Based in Singapore or Seattle)
Company: ViSenze - Artificial Intelligence for the Visual W...
Description:
ViSenze is one of the fastest growing A.I. start-ups and a recognised market leader in the development and implementation of visual recognition technology in retail. To help us build upon our success, we are seeking a Global Head of Solutions to be responsible for the implementation and management of Visenzes’ suite of AI Computer Vision Solutions. This is a newly created role that will suit an experienced executive with the right combination of customer focus, business acumen and an excellent technology pedigree.
Managing a Solutions Group comprising Solution Consultants and Solution Engineers and leading a cross-functional team in a matrix environment, you will liaise closely with our CTO and internal R&D and product teams, domain experts and external technology partners. With this team, you will manage the end to end delivery lifecycle for a defined roadmap of AI Computer Vision enabled solutions built upon Visenze’s market leading AI Computer Vision platform that solve challenging business problems for the Retail and Commerce industry.
Reporting to the CCO and working closely with the CEO and CTO, this role is a critical leadership role for Visenze as we help global Retailers and Brands transform every facet of their business with AI Computer Vision solutions.
Your team will:
Play a leading role in the development, expansion and refinement of ViSenze’s enhanced AI Computer Vision solutions for our customers globally
Play a proactive role in prioritising our Solution and Product roadmap for our AI Products and Solutions
Be a conduit and liaison with our Account Execs and Customer Success teams, between our customers, partners and engineering teams
Ensure success in helping our customers accelerate their adoption of our solutions; identifying unique problems and unlocking opportunities through your team of Solution Consultants and Engineers
Lead collaboration activities with major Technology and Solution Partners
Responsibilities
Managing a team of Solution Consultants and Engineers in pre-sales and solution implementation activities
Overseeing the development and ongoing enhancements to Visenze’s AI Computer Vision based Solutions
Coaching and mentoring Pre-Sales teams to successfully engage and conduct one-to-few and one-to-many training sessions to deliver technical understanding and training to customers adopting technology
Working with Visenze Account Execs to support sales and partnership activities with key ViSenze customers, vendors and third -party providers
Identifying strategic opportunities and mapping our Solutions to deliver optimised AI CV solutions to global retailers and brands across all channels
Serving as a leading solution expert in ViSenze and across the community, including and not limited to serving the most strategic Accounts globally
Helping customer facing teams to drive adoption of ViSenze solutions within strategic accounts, expanding usage across the enterprise by translating technical features into value drivers, selling through overcoming technical objections, responding to RFP technical documents, solution and persona-based selling
Establishing your presence as a Senior Go-To Leader in the business for Solution knowledge, positioning and technical understanding
Evangelising best practices in sales/solutioning engineering and leading by example and practice via engagements with top ViSenze clients globally
Requirements
15+ years’ experience in Technology Delivery and GTM roles (Technical Delivery Management / Solution Architecture, Solution Engineering)
Strong knowledge of E-Commerce / Retail industry through a Solutions Delivery, Consulting or Pre-Sales Leadership role where you’ve developed your client-facing and technical skills
5+ years management of technical, customer facing resources
5+ years supporting SaaS/Cloud Enterprise applications sales
Understanding of application standards and technologies relating to SaaS products and ability to communicate business value of SaaS products and product architectures
High energy, self-starter comfortable with ambiguity and rapid change inherent in fast growing, entrepreneurial environments
Outstanding professional, sales, communication, and technical capabilities;
Some knowledge and understanding of AI in Machine Learning, Big Data is preferable
Significant experience responding to RFPs and negotiating SLAs
Relevant degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Analytics or equivalent



About ViSenze
ViSenze powers visual commerce at scale with deep learning and computer vision. Used by the world's biggest retailers like Uniqlo and ASOS, ViSenze simplifies the way shoppers search and discover products; converting images into engagement opportunities, and making content shoppable. Today, ViSenze is acknowledged amongst top global AI startups by Interbrand, CognitionX, CBInsights, A100, VentureBeat, Datamation, eMarketer, and Forrester. The company has raised over USD34 million in funding to date from marque investors including Rakuten.
Ranked as top 10 tech companies in 2019 by Glassdoor in Singapore and an award winner of The Best Tech Company to Work For 2019, ViSenze offers a rare opportunity to join a thriving, fast-paced, multi-cultural environment and be part of a truly exciting journey of a pioneering A.I. company.
Visenze is also one of the founding AWS Global Retail Competency partners.

gTech’s Professional Services team takes a creative, collaborative, and customer-centric approach to provide foundational services and forward-looking business solutions to top advertiser and publisher customers. Through technical implementation, optimization, and key solutions, gTech Professional Services helps customers attain their business goals while building long-term capabilities.
The Global Client and Agency Solutions (GCAS) Customer Solutions Engineering team is responsible for developing innovative, cutting-edge solutions to the business problems faced by the world’s largest advertisers. Your solutions will take many forms, from prototypes and demos to education - all with the technology resources of Google to back it up.
You will be responsible for identifying and prioritizing your own projects. You will see the unique business challenges faced by our largest advertisers and you will be given the opportunity to develop solutions no one else has. Google creates products and services that make the world a better place, and gTech’s role is to help bring them to life. Our teams of trusted advisors support customers globally. Our solutions are rooted in our technical skill, product expertise, and a thorough understanding of our customers’ complex needs. Whether the answer is a bespoke solution to solve a unique problem, or a new tool that can scale across Google, everything we do aims to ensure our customers benefit from the full potential of Google products.

To learn more about gTech, check out our video.

Design and implement complex, cross-product customized solutions with clients.

Title: Director of Product (Partner Experience), APAC
Description:
At foodpanda we're on a mission to redefine how tech, food, people and culture are connected operating in 12 countries worldwide. Our team is working on big challenges and complex scalability problems as we grow 6X annually processing millions of orders a year. You'll be part of a highly collaborative cross-functional agile squad that always includes frontend and backend engineers, design and product owners. Our squads operate in an open and fast-paced environment with very flat structures where everyone has a say.
We work on a large scale, complex systems where you can reach users on a global scale whilst enjoying a high level of autonomy and influence and a flexible working environment. Here you can learn, thrive and become a better engineer, designer and product manager.
Director of Product (Partner Experience), APAC
We are looking for a Director of Product to lead one of our tribes in Singapore. As a Director you will be responsible and accountable to define and deliver features that contribute to the growth of Restaurant Partner Services vertical across different markets.You'll define the value propositions, product Vision & strategy, go to market and KPIs we should focus on to make our Restaurant Partner's lives better and to grow foodpanda business.
You will work closely with engineers, product management and user experience designers to build best-in-class services and apps. You will liaise with other product management and leadership teams and work closely with business development, marketing, finance, legal to get feedback from partners ,customers and international teams to define and build product requirements in order to grow the business.
You will be helping in building an organization based on smart people, diversity, and individuals with a "can-do" attitude that want to build apps and services used daily by foodpanda customers and vendors worldwide.
What's on the menu:
Set the vision and strategy for foodpanda verticals with our executive and engineering teams.
You will directly manage a tribe and 8+ Products and Product managers who are focused on Partner service products
Execute a robust and comprehensive strategy, product roadmap, and business plan for foodpanda business
Define the roadmap, business requirements, measures of success, and features for your products and services, and work with your PM team to drive and deliver these to market.
Identify and execute on opportunities to drive up engagement for users
Grow revenue directly attributable to value created within foodpanda verticals
Operate strong feedback loops, identify and drive measurements, and creatively use data sources to craft better experiences and ensure we are building the right products over time.
Collaborate with marketing, business development, design, engineering, analytics, and other product managers to drive our business with meaningful value to our user base and to ensure alignment with Product strategy
Drive highly visible and impactful decisions for your area.
Keep apprised of new innovations and trends in the industry
What you can bring to the table:
10+ years of experience building complex software or application platforms (Mobile + Web)
5+ years experience in complex e-commerce product
7+ years in product management
7+ years managing organizations while still remaining hands-on to the details
5+ years directly managing product managers
Willing to take action and ambitious with ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic atmosphere
Thrive between the balance of customer experience and commercial needs
Able to deal with ambiguity and be able to break down barriers
Ability to balance priorities and multi-task
Experience in presenting to senior management and building consensus
Turn business requirements into a road map of features broken down by quarter
Maintain a prioritized backlog with clear and concise user stories
Sound product and execution skills and ability to perform under tight deadlines
Able to be very detailed while keeping an eye on the big picture
Define key requirements and go deep on the details as needed
Be the SME for the feature(s) / product you are driving
Develop metrics and reporting for features
Understand the systems and technologies behind your product, their limitations, scaling factors, boundary conditions, and reasons for architectural decisions.
Drive alignment across program and technology teams to deliver on stakeholder needs.
Experience in building platform solutions, defining services and applications
About foodpanda
foodpanda (small 'f') is the world's favourite way to order food online from the comfort of your home or office. Whether it's getting your hands on your favourite pasta, kebab or pizza, we believe that no one should have to suffer from hunger attacks ever again.
Our parent company, Delivery Hero, is a global leader in the food delivery industry processing over 3 million orders every day and operating in 40+ markets in the world, with 18,000 employees and approximately 500,000+ restaurant partners. In APAC, foodpanda operates in over 150 cities across 12 countries. Trivial problems can always become large technical challenges at scale. If you love technology, efficiency and simplicity as much as we do, there is no better place to experience this than in foodpanda.
We always genuinely care about experience, efficiency and scalability. We do not just solve technical problems but build the foundations for foodpanda's operations with the best tools on hand.

Title: Big Data Engineer
Description:
Permanent role

Title: Senior Data Engineer
Description:
We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer to work in Tokyo, Japan who is excited to build the next-generation data processing that can handle large scale workloads. The right candidate has a solid background in setting up complex and scalable CI pipelines and a good understanding of Machine Learning.
RESPONSIBILITY
・Maintain and continuously improve large scale iterative labelling, experimenting, training, and deploying processing pipelines for modern deep learning on cameras, LiDARs, radars, and other sensor data.
・Communicate, scope and design new features to meet the needs of clients inside and outside of the company
・Develop and integrate data handling tools and work with teams to provide ground-truth in support of machine learning and simulation.
・Live and breathe the software practices that produce maintainable code, including automated testing, continuous integration, code style conformity, and code review.

TECHNICAL QUALIFICATIONS
Software engineering
・Service oriented architecture
・Microservices
・Experience with devtools: Jira, Github, Gitlab, Jenkins, Artifactory
・Experience with building, owning, managing and operating data platforms

Infrastructure
・Infrastructure as Code: Terraform
・Containers: Docker
・AWS experience including:
・・・Compute: EC2, ECS, EKS, Lambda, Batch
・・・Storage: S3
・・・Database: DynamoDB, Redshift
・・・Networking: API Gateway
・・・Security / Identity: IAM, Cognito
・・・Application Integration: Step functions, SQS, SNS
・Big Data / Analytics: Glue, EMR, Athena, Kinesis, ElasticSearch, Quicksight, Spark

Data
We require experience with one of the following:
・Computer vision and image processing
・Sensor processing and fusion
・Time series data processing
・Deep learning frameworks and building software on top of these frameworks such as PyTorch and Tensorflow

Soft Skills
・Excellent communication and organization skills
・Business level English
・Agile mindset
・Strong sense of ownership

Title: SWAT Director - Emerging Technologies
Description:
As part of their aggressive 2020 recruitment plans, a global bank with a strong regional footprint has made available a SWAT Director - Emerging Technologies job to build and lead the new corporate banking APAC "SWAT" technology team.
About the SWAT Director - Emerging Technologies Role:
Aside from delivering innovative digital and data solutions across Singapore, Shanghai and Hong Kong, you will lead a team that acts as a rapid application development style team taking forward new digital and data solutions from ideas to fruition within the APAC market. Projects will cover topics such as data visualisation/analytics, client APIs, RPA/process automation, document digitisation/OCR, distributed ledger solutions and machine learning/artificial intelligence. Deliveries will be aimed to increase revenue, improve client services and be cost efficient.
Key Responsibilities:
Develop new technology applications/services in partnership with business and operations stakeholders to transform the GTB business
Lead a team of engineers to design and build software for the corporate bank division
Partner with UI/UX design team, architects, business analysts and stakeholders situated in multiple regions and time zones, at varying capacity to understand requirements
Shape the future of the technology stack and apply it innovatively to solve complex problems
Act as the technical advocate for new technologies such as Kafka, Hadoop, Kubernetes, Dockers, etc., and how to leverage these in a corporate environment
Design and develop source code, including descriptions, for all software components, in accordance with detailed software requirements specification, the functional design and the technical design document
Embrace automated unit/integration testing as a standard development practice
Promote a DevOps culture and modern tool chains to support continuous delivery
To succeed in this SWAT Director - Emerging Technologies role, you must be passionate about the latest tech stack, previously ran MVPs/POCs and have prior experience delivering business benefit whilst building new modern and efficient solutions that incrementally replace or compliment their existing platforms and strategic road map.
Key Requirements:
Strong experience in AI or Data Analytics/Big Data advantageous
Desirable to have experience building machine learning models for recommending products and actions
Experience in C#/Java/Groovy programming in digitisation and data extraction from documents using AI and robotic process automation is preferred
Master’s degree in computer science, computer engineering or information technology
Eight years' hands-on experience developing Microservices using Spring Boot framework
Five years' hands-on experience with Kafka message/event stream-processing
Five years' hands-on experience with Hadoop (Spark, HBASE, Impala)
Three years' hands-on experience with React, HTML, CSS (UI development)
Three years' hands-on experience with enterprise search platforms such as Elastic and/or Solr+
Two years' hands-on experience with Oracle 12c or higher Hands-on experience developing solutions on Linux Rhel6.x or higher OS
Application development experience using Agile Methodology, Scrum Master certification is preferred
Strong server-side Java development skills. Ability to develop reusable and performant Java aligned with good architectural and design principles
Experience with test driven development (TDD) and writing automated tests
Sound understanding of DevOps practices and software toolchain. Practical experience with modern DevOps build chains and CI/CD tools (Maven, Gradle, Git, Jenkins or TeamCity)
Experience in deployment to container environments (Docker, Kubernetes)
Scripting experience in Bash or Python is a plus
Knowledge in corporate banking business is ideal. Candidates without banking experience are strongly encouraged to apply
The successful candidate will join a technology-centric business, with an increasing move to real-time processing, an increasing appetite from customers for integrated systems and access to supporting data.
If you are seeking an opportunity to partner with a team that works on diverse range of solutions using cutting-edge technology every day, a team that is equipped with modern technologies and use modern practices including micro-services development, DevOps and more, that works with many open source tools including Apache Kafka, Flink, ElasticSearch, Apache Spark and Open shift, this SWAT Director - Emerging Technologies role is right for you.
Interested candidates, please apply today.
Robert Walters (Singapore) Pte Ltd
ROC No.: 199706961E | EA Licence No.: 03C5451
EA Registration No.: R1332085 Valerie Corera

As part of their aggressive 2020 recruitment plans, a global bank with a strong regional footprint has made available a SWAT Director - Emerging Technologies job to build and lead the new corporate banking APAC "SWAT" technology team.

Title: #SGUNITEDJOBS DEVOPS ENGINEER (ENTERPRISE INFORMATION MANAGE...
Description:
Join our project Enterprise Information Management team to take on the exciting and challenging role of delivering and maintaining an agency-wide data warehouse and analytics project. If you are passionate about championing the team to continuously refactor and improve so as to deliver creative and quality software products, we welcome you to join us as a DevOps Engineer!
What to Expect:
Provide production and operational support for a 24x7 system
Participate in planning, evaluating, building and maintaining new big data infrastructure and development platform for analytics and data science
Develop automation code for deployment and integrate new components in the system
Perform automated deployments to existing or new infrastructure environments
Build Continuous Integration and Delivery (CI/CD) pipeline for applications
Liaise with 3rd party software/hardware vendors to manage and resolve incidents and technical issues
How to Succeed:
Degree or Diploma in Computer Science, Information Technology or related disciplines
Hands-on experience in SQL and Microsoft technologies, preferably for Business Intelligence and data management, using tools including, but not limited to:
SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
SQL Server Analytics Services (SSAS)
SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS)
Power BI
Sharepoint
Team Foundation Studio
JIRA
Experience in one or more of the following will be an added advantage:
Virtualisation (e.g. VMWare VSphere family of products)
Container Technologies (e.g. Docker)
Secure code review / Automated testing
Big Data platforms (e.g. Hadoop, Git)
Scripting languages (e.g. PowerShell, R, Python)
.NET programming
Agile Continuous Integration tools
Team player with good communication (interpersonal and verbal) skills

Description:
Responsibilities:
Degree in Computer Engineering or equivalent
Must be Singaporean with G50 Security clearance
Conversant with Java programming including XML and a plus with hands-on experience on front end tools such as Flash or HTML5
Experience in liaising with client on requirements etc
Familiar with databases such as Oracle or SQL
Has been in a similar position for at least 4 years or equivalent
Exposure in data analytics and data mining in big data system will be an advantage but not essential.
Requirements:
Exposure in Eclipse and Tomcat
Knowledge of Big Data & Expert Systems such as HP's IDOL, Marklogic etc will be an added advantage.

Title: Research Engineer
Description:
The Living Analytics Research Centre (LARC) is a research centre set up in Singapore Management University (SMU) with Carnegie Mellon University (CMU) as our strategic partner that focuses Urban and Community Liveability, Personalised Urban Mobility, Jobs and Skills Intelligence, as well as Smart Consumption andHealthy Lifestyle. Candidates who join us can also expect to gain a deeper knowledge in the following areassuch as Big Data Analytics, Data Mining, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Human Computer Interaction, Urban Computing and other relevant disciplines. The candidate will be working on key initiatives and projects with internal or external partners in the followingaspects: Conduct research in the above areas Gather requirements from project partners through discussions and correspondence Develop, design and implement research prototypes and test-bed systems to achieve project requirements and targets, as well as to showcase the centre’s analytics capabilities Showcase LARC’s projects at events or conferences Assist other researchers to collect and extract relevant data for research purposes Qualifications Bachelor/Master Degree in Computer Science or relevant disciplines Good knowledge of Databases, Data Mining, Distributed Computing, Operating Systems Proficient in at least one or more of these programming languages: Java, Python, C#, C++, C Experience in the following technologies will be beneficial: Elasticsearch Apache Storm RabbitMQ Redis MySQL, Postgresql Tomcat, NodeJS, Apache, Nginx and Xampp Linux Environment (CentOS 6.x, Ubuntu 14.x), Bash Scripting Virtualization (VMWare, KVM, Vagrant, Docker) GPU Computing and Deep Learning Self-motivated and able to carry out tasks independently Excellent team player and possess strong inter-personal skill

Title: Specialist SA, Machine Learning
Description:
3+ years of experience in design/implementation/consulting for Machine Learning/AI/Deep Learning solutions
3+ years of experience with one or more Deep Learning frameworks such as Apache MXNet, TensorFlow, Caffe2, Keras, Microsoft Cognitive Toolkit, Torch and Theano
5+ years professional experience in software development in languages related to ML like Python or R. Experience working with RESTful API and general service-oriented architectures
3+ years of experience in technical architecture, design, deployment and operations for AI platforms, standards, protocols and devices

Are you passionate about Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning and Deep Learning? Are you passionate about helping customers build solutions leveraging the state-of-the-art AI/ML/DL tools on Amazon Web Service (AWS)?

Come join us!

At Amazon, we’ve been investing deeply in artificial intelligence for over 20 years, and many of the capabilities customers experience are driven by machine learning. Amazon.com’s recommendations engine is driven by machine learning (ML), as are the paths that optimise robotic picking routes in our fulfilment centres. Our supply chain, forecasting, and capacity planning are also informed by ML algorithms. Alexa is fueled by Natural Language Understanding and Automated Speech Recognition deep learning; as is Prime Air, and the computer vision technology in our new retail experience, Amazon Go. We have thousands of engineers at Amazon committed to machine learning and deep learning, and it’s a big part of our heritage.

Within AWS, we’re focused on bringing that knowledge and capability to customers through three layers of the AI stack:
1) Frameworks and Infrastructure with tools like Apache MxNet and TensorFlow,
2) Machine Learning Platforms such as Amazon SageMaker for data scientists and
3) API-driven Services like Amazon Lex, Amazon Polly, Amazon Transcribe, Amazon Comprehend, and Amazon Rekognition to quickly add intelligence to applications with a simple API call.

AWS is looking for a Machine Learning Solutions Architect (ML SA), who will be the Subject Matter Expert (SME) for helping customers in ASEAN design solutions that leverage our ML services. As part of the team, you will work closely with customers to enable large-scale use cases, design ML pipelines, and drive the adoption of AWS for the ML/AI platforms. You will interact with other SAs in the field, providing guidance on their customer engagements, and you will develop white papers, blogs, reference implementations, and presentations to enable customers to fully leverage ML/AI on AWS. Additionally, as the voice of the customer, you will work closely with the service teams, and submit product feature requests to drive the platform forward.

You must have deep technical experience working with technologies related to artificial intelligence, machine learning and/or deep learning. A strong mathematics and statistics background is preferred in addition to experience building complex machine learning models. You will be familiar with the ecosystem of software vendors in the AI/ML space, and will leverage this knowledge to help AWS customers in their selection process.

Your roles and responsibilities will include:
Work with customers’ development and data science teams to deeply understand their business and technical needs and design ML solutions that make the best use of AWS SageMaker, the AWS AI Services and the AWS cloud platform.
Thought Leadership – Evangelise AWS ML services and share best practices through forums such as AWS blogs, whitepapers, reference architectures and public-speaking events such as AWS Singapore Summit, AWS re:Invent, etc.
Partner with SAs, Sales, Business Development and the AI/ML Service teams to accelerate customer adoption and revenue attainment in ASEAN of Amazon SageMaker.
Act as a technical liaison between customers and the AWS SageMaker services teams to provide customer driven product improvement feedback.
Contribute to the development and support of an AWS internal community of ML related subject matter experts.

Graduate degree in a highly quantitative field (Computer Science, Machine Learning, Operations Research, Statistics, Mathematics, etc.)
· 5+ years of industry experience in predictive modeling and analysis · Ability to develop experimental and analytic plans for data modeling processes, use of strong baselines, ability to accurately determine cause and effect relationships
Consulting experience and track record of helping customers with their AI needs
Publications or presentation in recognised Machine Learning, Deep Learning and Data Mining journals/conferences
Experience with AWS technologies like Sagemaker, Redshift, S3, EC2, Data Pipeline, Kinesis & EMR
Knowledge of SparkML
Able to write production level code, which is well-written and explainable
Experience using ML libraries, such as scikit-learn, caret, mlr, mllib
Experience working with GPUs to develop models
Experience handling terabyte size datasets
Track record of diving into data to discover hidden patterns
Familiarity with using data visualisation tools
Knowledge and experience of writing and tuning SQL
Past and current experience writing and speaking about complex technical concepts to broad audiences in a simplified format
Experience giving data presentations
