Title: Solution Consulting-Consultant II
Description:
FICO (NYSE: FICO) is a leading global analytics software company, helping businesses in 90+ countries make better decisions. Join our world-class team today and fulfill your career potential!
Job Summary
Primary Job Description
Implementation of FICO Fraud & Compliance products for domestic and international customers
Conducting / participating in Project Kick-off workshops, Solution Integration and design discussions, product demonstrations and documenting customer expectations in a way the team can implement the solutions
Integration and customization of solutions including building bridge interfaces, data transformation layers, ETL, etc. including identifying the right technology solution for the given problem statement, design, development, testing, packaging and releasing to various environments
Installation, configuration and deployment of product OOB components and custom components internally and at customer sites
Consult, Guide and Engage with customer through the integration testing, performance testing, user acceptance testing, security testing and various other testing cycles the project may deem necessary
Identify reusability of various solution components and further enhance the degree of reusability in every solution integration work unit
Work with Product Development (PTO), Product Support and Customer to resolve various product gaps, defects and enhancement requests in a mutually agreeable way
Train the customers’ technology teams on Administration, Housekeeping and Maintenance aspects of the solutions implemented at their site
Document Lessons Learnt and Best Practices as part of each engagement and work on continual process improvement to streamline and enhance the implementation experience further and reduce the implementation risks

Technical Skills / Competency
Bachelor or Master Degree in Engineering/Technology in Computer Sciences, Computer Applications or such similar stream
Minimum 6 years of relevant IT experience in a financial sector that processes high volume transactions
Strong knowledge/understanding of Linux/windows server administration
Proficient in use of command line interface and basic scripting (shell, Perl, Python etc.)
Expert in Java Programming Language and related frameworks (JEE, Spring, Hibernate, etc.)
Experience in Data Streaming and Message Oriented Middleware frameworks like Apache Camel, Kafka, ApacheMQ, RabbitMQ, Mule, etc.
Thorough understanding of working on Physical and Virtual environment
Strong knowledge/understanding of internet protocols and standards (e.g. IP, TCP, UDP, HTTP/HTTPS, DNS)
Proficient in RDBMS databases like MySQL, Oracle, Microsoft SQL Server
Exposure/Experience in NoSQL databases like MongoDB, ElasticSearch, Couchbase will be an added advantage
Strong familiarity with app servers, web servers and load balancing technologies
Hands-on experience in deploying, configuring and maintaining web, java and open source applications on Linux (RHEL,windows, CentOS etc.) is required
Knowledge of capturing system level logs, dumps, application logs, database logs, event logs
Exposure to System monitoring application like Nagios, HPOV, Zabbix etc will be an added advantage
Experience with building and maintaining environments running Apache, Tomcat, NGINX, and Java/ J2EE based applications
Experience utilizing tools such as New Relic, Riverbed, Splunk, OEM or similar is desirable but not mandatory
Working knowledge of software version control concepts and change management processes
Knowledge of data security practices, secure coding practices, OWASP and PCI-DSS security standards
Domain knowledge of Banking sector, specifically in Transaction Monitoring, AML (Anti money laundering) and KYC (Know your customer) would be desirable
Job Description
The Opportunity
"The FICO Origination Solution product suite empowers financial institutions to reinvent the origination process by bringing a set of market-leading technology and analytic capabilities together into a single comprehensive solution. We are looking for results driven professionals that believe in teamwork and thrive on exceeding expectations. This exciting consulting role allows you to work with several analytic innovations and software technologies as part of strategically important, highly visible projects." - Sr. Director, Professional Services
What You’ll Contribute
You will have the opportunity to collaborate with a talented matrix team of FICO Engineers, Product Managers, Project Managers and Solution Consultants to lead the implementation team effort. You will manage contact between the customer and all sales, configuration, data migration, development, professional services, support and project team members during the implementation process.
You will be able to work closely with our customer project teams to ensure that all aspects of the implementations are delivered successfully and on time.
Lead the customer relationship with regular on-site visits during the implementation process.
Manage issues and enhancements identified throughout the project by working with the appropriate FICO team members.
What We’re Seeking
Bachelor's degree in technical (engineering, software, etc.) or highly related field.
Provide large-scale software implementation for external customers in the financial services industry.
A great communicator, with the ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the public.
Excellent troubleshooting skills, analytical problem-solving skills, and the ability to solve technical challenges.
A team player who can bring a positive attitude and productivity in high pressure situations.
20-25% travel on periodic basis as customer and implementation cycle requires.
Our Offer to You
A culture and work environment strongly reflecting our core values: Act like an Owner, Delight Our Customers and Earn the Respect of Others.
The opportunity to make a difference by leveraging your unique strengths.
Highly competitive compensation and rewards.
Flexible work options, opportunities to give back to your community, social events with colleagues and a comprehensive benefits program inclusive of progressive parental leave.
Why Make a Move to FICO?
At FICO, you can develop your career with a leading organization in one of the fastest-growing fields in technology today – Big Data analytics. You’ll play a part in our commitment to help businesses use data to improve every choice they make, using advances in artificial intelligence, machine learning, predictive and prescriptive modeling, and much more.
FICO makes a real difference in the way businesses operate worldwide:
Credit Scoring — 150+ billion FICO Scores have been sold to date, making it the most used credit score in the world.
Fraud Detection and Security — 2.6+ billion payment cards globally are protected by FICO fraud systems.
Lending — 3/4 of US mortgages are approved using the FICO Score.
Anti-Money Laundering — our solutions check more than half a billion transactions a day to prevent criminal schemes such as terrorist financing
Global trends toward digital transformation have created tremendous demand for FICO’s solutions, placing us among the world’s top 100 software companies by revenue. We support many of the world’s largest banks, insurers, retailers, telecommunications providers and other firms reach a new level of success.
Our success is dependent on really talented people – just like you – who thrive on the collaboration and innovation that’s nurtured by a diverse and inclusive environment. We’ll provide the support you need, while ensuring you have the freedom to develop your skills and grow your career. Join FICO and help change the way business thinks!
Learn more about how you can fulfill your potential at www.fico.com/Careers
FICO values the benefit that diversity and a culture of inclusion bring to our workplace. We are an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and we’re proud to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants without regard to race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, pregnancy, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

Title: Technical Manager (Risk & Reporting)
Lead Consultant
Description:
Role Summary
You will be responsible for building the business' data collection systems and processing highly available data pipelines that facilitate deeper analysis and reporting by the business users. You will also be building data processing frameworks that handle the business's growing database and will work with the business users in leveraging data with reporting and scientific tools. In addition, you will strive to continuously develop new and improved data engineering capabilities.

Job Responsibilities
Implement strategies directed at acquiring data and promoting the development of new insights across the business. You will own and extend the business's data pipeline through the collection, storage, processing, and transformation of large data-sets.
Monitor the existing metrics, analyze data, and work with business users to identify and implement system and process improvements.
Develop queries for ad hoc business projects, as well as ongoing reporting. In this capacity, you will build a metadata system where all available data is maintained and catalogued. You will also play a major role in the development of reliable data pipelines that translate raw data into powerful features and signals.
Designs, architects, implements, and supports key datasets that avail structured and timely access to actionable business insights. You will also be responsible with developing ETL processes that convert data into formats through dashboard charts.
Work closely with the business users in gathering requirements for data governance across the department and the business at large.
Apply best practices as well as defining the business's data requirements, which will ensure that the collected data is of a high quality and optimal for use across the departments and business at large.
Analyze and understand data sources, participating in design, and providing insights and guidance on database technology and data modelling best practices.
Develop and manage scalable data processing platforms that will be used for exploratory data analysis and real-time analytics. You will oversee, design, and develop algorithms for real-time data processing within the business and to create the frameworks that enable quick and efficient data acquisition.
Retrieve and analyze data using SQL, Excel among other data management systems. You will also build data loading services for importing data from numerous disparate data sources, inclusive of APIs, logs, relational, and non-relational databases.
Contribute to the continual improvement of the business's data platforms.
Job Requirements
Degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, Information Technology or related fields.
Relevant experience in working within a data engineering department, preferably as a Data Engineer in a fast-paced environment and complex business setting
Demonstrate experience in building and maintaining reliable and scalable ETL on big data platforms as well as experience working with varied forms of data infrastructure inclusive of relational databases such as SQL, Hadoop, Spark and column-oriented databases such as Redshift, MySQL, and Vertica.
Experience in data warehousing inclusive of dimensional modelling concepts and demonstrate proficiency in scripting languages, for example, Python, Perl, etc.
Experience in working in SQL server reporting services, analysis services, Tableau, Salesforce, integration services, or any other data visualization tools.
Ability to perform complex data analyses with large data volumes.
Proficient in SQL, Java, and have a keen understanding of data models and data warehouse concepts.
Experience working with big data infrastructure tools such as Python, SQS, Redshift, Scala, Spark, Spark Streaming, AWS and/or EMR.

Summary
Posted: Dec 10, 2019
Role Number:200129743
Do you like the idea of working on services that are used by millions of passionate people around the world? Do you enjoy working on challenges that are not yet solved? Do you want to change the world? Imagine what you could do here at Apple! Apple puts users and user experience first, and is a place where new futuristic ideas and innovations have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services and the present very quickly. Description
Apple Media Products is looking for a software engineering to provide new and enhanced architecture, software, tools and monitoring to support its fast paced growth. Join our exciting team that is dedicated to providing the highest quality video products to our customers. Our team is responsible for the software that drive real-time end-to-end video service quality and influence the performance and architecture of delivering video. We are looking for a team player who is able to tackle problems under a tight deadline constraints and deliver imaginative solutions. Responsibilities will include: tools and applications to support measuring and monitoring video quality, building data analytics and real-time dashboards, driving innovations to deliver best-in-class video optimizations, and finally working across Apple from customer care to core platforms to build the capabilities.
Education & Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science and Engineering or related field 10+ years of industry experience

Title: #SGUNITEDJOBS FULL STACK SOLUTION ARCHITECT
Company: CARGILL ASIA PACIFIC HOLDINGS PTE. LTD.
Description:
Position Purpose & Summary:

The Solution Architect –Trading is responsible for consulting and providing direction on all management and development initiatives related to the APAC region for the complex Trading Ecosystem. The Ecosytem comprises an integrated mix of old and new technologies (CTRM, Trade Executions, Physicals Operations, Data & Analytics) with on-premise and SaaS based solutions in play.

This is a role with balanced responsibilities for understanding needs, both business and technical, and develops and maintains complex solutions that sustain and protect the integrity of the overall Trading Ecosystem and its complex set of integrations and interfaces to other parts of the organization such as Treasury and our ERP’s. By understanding the Trading domain and the latest technologies, the candidate has the opportunity to drive the modernization of front office trading applications, including systems of records and trading analytics technology.

Working closely with the global architects, the APAC solution architect will be responsible to assist managers in setting the medium term direction, roadmaps and standards for functional, process, and/or technical solutions, ensuring they align to the overall Enterprise Architecture and how global trading platforms can integrate into the APAC environment.

Familiarity with the Global IT Trading Strategy is key in order to provide the right counsel on all aspects of application development and architecture design including – performance, scalability, coding, caching, security, encryption, session state management, and error logging and testing. In addition, this position plays a key bridging role across requirements analysis, design, development and testing.
Utilizing robust knowledge of architecture, may play a role in negotiations with key vendors and participates in key vendor relationship management process.

The strategic importance of an Enterprise wide data driven strategy to drive the development of Digitalization and Analytics across the Trading environment globally requires this role to be effective in working with data architects, data modelers, data engineers and data scientists.

This position requires an expert in the architecture space with advanced knowledge to independently conduct the most complex activities. Responsible for managing a large portfolio of architecture solutions, with a long-term outlook.

This will include: Architecture strategy and planning, business partnering, relationship management and consulting, governance and portfolio management, architecture definition methodology, and people and budget management.

The position holder must demonstrate an ability to deal with ambiguity, work under pressure to tight deadlines and a willingness to develop strong knowledge and expertise in the trading domain.

The Solution Architect will act as a coach and mentor for more junior team members both onshore and offshore and may be involved as a technical subject matter expert in the resolution of Level3 application support issues.

Direct experience working in an Agile approach, is preferred, as is understand of DevOps environment and other technology trends.
Overall the role requires the resource to be able to link business process with current system map and assess complex issues from multiple angles. It also requires the resource to be a strategic thinker and have the experience to evolve the solution in place to adapt to changing clients needs as well as changes based on market trends.

Technical Skills: We work with a variety of vendor products and technologies. As such we prefer the successful candidate to have a broad exposure to multiple different initiatives. The role requires taking an unbiased structured approach to determining the best solutions, satisfying the requirements of a large number of stakeholders.
Business Knowledge: Commodities Trading, Physicals Trading and Operations, Risks & Valuation. Metals Trading experiences is desirable.

Principal Accountabilities:

60% - Project Execution - Systems Analysis and Development:
Analyses user system and application needs, determine and evaluate potential solutions, develop system specifications and requirements, and design application programs to meet the requirements.
Interacts with business and IT resources to understand and analyze business, functional, and technical requirements.
Works with business(es) to help shape the direction of the products based on a combined knowledge of what is technically feasible and what is desired by the end user.
Design and estimate integrated solutions which may include applications, databases, networks, and related systems
Provide consult and strategic architectural oversight during the design, build and test phases and tests automation of all projects
Provide advice on the resources required to support and execute projects.
Participate in the selection of those resources.
Provides coaching on the Ecosystem to 3rd parties engaged in our projects and/or training to more junior members of the team, including coaching Cargill core values (e.g. data privacy).
Work with business(es) to help shape the direction of the product based on a combined knowledge of what is technically feasible and what is desired by the end user.
Conduct design and code reviews with peers, business system analysts, and quality assurance teams.
Participate during system/integration/UAT testing and provide timely and accurate defect resolution.
Create the Material and provide the Governance in order to maintain the Ecosystem live and safe.

30% - Strategy, Business Partnering and Consulting:
Develops a good understanding of the Trading Business Unit (BU) Strategy and most specifically its direction in terms of Process, Data and Technology (PDT).
Develops a deep and broad understanding of the existing Global Trading Ecosystem.
Develops an understanding of the Cargill Metals, Cargill Agriculture Supply Chain (CASC), Enterprise Data & Digitalization Strategy and the strategic importance of the Cargill Data Platform (CDP)
Consults with Global Trading Solution Owners and Architects to ensure full awareness of target or solution architecture as part of the Global IT Trading Strategy.
Evaluates industry trends and vendor products in close consultation with Global Trading Solution Owners and Architects.
Provides leadership by pro-actively sharing insights and knowledge to advise BU and Functional Management on its Long-Term Strategic Direction for Process, Data and Technology (PDT) with the aim of finding better solutions.
Pro-actively participates in the assessment of potential projects and the development of a meaningful roadmap for delivery.
Plays a key leadership role in championing data as a corporate asset and ensuring the value realization of the investments Cargill is making in data and information.

10% - Project Management Office Leadership:
Develop a good understanding of the Cargill Data Platform (CDP) and some of the projects and initiatives being worked around it.
Collaborate effectively with our Cargill Data Team and Business Intelligence stakeholders.
Structure, implement, and maintain database systems.
Establish policies, standards and procedures to ensure useful and readily accessible data.
Analyse data requirements, develop and document data dictionary, and develop data models.
Develop, maintain and support associated databases.

Required Education & Experience:
BA/BS in Business, IT, or Computer Science or equivalent
10-15 years of IT and business / industry work experience
Experience with software development methodologies and SDLC
Ability to Deliver Results (Quality & Benefits)
Proven expertise in designing end to end solution.
Experienced working an offshore development model
Strong collaboration and influencing skills
Demonstrated ability to be successful in ambiguous situations
Experience working in a matrixed and leveraged organization
Experience anticipating emerging issues, problem solving and implementing new business solutions across process data and technology
Experience interacting effectively, confidentially and appropriately with various levels management and customers
Business fluency in English and local languages as defined
Willing to travel up to 15% of the time

Preferred Skills & Experience:
5 years’ experience working in Trading applications
Demonstrated experience in the design of clean, efficient, usable application interfaces from conceptualization to implementation
Proven track record of designing scalable, reliable, high performance software applications with an emphasis on Digitalization and Analytics
Proven track record of anticipating emerging issues, problem solving & implementing new solutions, including improving efficiency, quality, cost & productivity
Practical Experience with emerging technologies and tools (IoT, Data Analytics, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
Nice to have knowledge and exposure around Big Data and Cloud architecture.

Title: Lead Data Engineer (Hadoop / Python / MatLab)
Description:
Opportunity to work with Advanced Technologies
High Impact Position
About Our Client
Our client is an upcoming Technology Platform and they are looking for a highly motivated Lead Data Engineer (Hadoop / Python / MatLab) to work with a diverse team of technical resources, product managers and develop advanced technology solutions.
Job Description
As the Lead Data Engineer (Hadoop / Python / MatLab), you are responsible for:
Identifying, reviewing, and determining the value of unstructured data from multiple sources before designing scalable systems to ingest the relevant data.
Developing the blueprint design for the data architecture on cloud platforms, ensuring scalability and efficiency.
Owning the data pipelines and driving continuous improvements in data quality reports.
Designing data models to support analytics reports, data transformation and data science models.
Collaborating with Industry Experts and Software Engineers to refine the selection of data sources and optimize the data collection process.
The Successful Applicant
As a successful applicant, you will have a Degree in Business Analytics or equivalent with at least 5 years of experience in the Data Engineering field, backed by strong working experience with both unstructured and structured data. You will also have a proven track record of working with Big Data tools such as Hadoop / Spark / Hive, coupled with relevant scripting experience using Python with NoSQL databases such as MongoDB / PostgreSQL.
You will have a strong experience with statistical programming tools such as MatLab / R / SAS in a UNIX / LINUX environment. You will also have relevant experience with data modelling and creating predictive models.
What's on Offer
Opportunity to work with Advanced Technologies
High Impact Position
Attractive Salary Package

Title: Senior Data Engineer
Description:
We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer to work in Tokyo, Japan who is excited to build the next-generation data processing that can handle large scale workloads. The right candidate has a solid background in setting up complex and scalable CI pipelines and a good understanding of Machine Learning.
RESPONSIBILITY
・Maintain and continuously improve large scale iterative labelling, experimenting, training, and deploying processing pipelines for modern deep learning on cameras, LiDARs, radars, and other sensor data.
・Communicate, scope and design new features to meet the needs of clients inside and outside of the company
・Develop and integrate data handling tools and work with teams to provide ground-truth in support of machine learning and simulation.
・Live and breathe the software practices that produce maintainable code, including automated testing, continuous integration, code style conformity, and code review.

TECHNICAL QUALIFICATIONS
Software engineering
・Service oriented architecture
・Microservices
・Experience with devtools: Jira, Github, Gitlab, Jenkins, Artifactory
・Experience with building, owning, managing and operating data platforms

Infrastructure
・Infrastructure as Code: Terraform
・Containers: Docker
・AWS experience including:
・・・Compute: EC2, ECS, EKS, Lambda, Batch
・・・Storage: S3
・・・Database: DynamoDB, Redshift
・・・Networking: API Gateway
・・・Security / Identity: IAM, Cognito
・・・Application Integration: Step functions, SQS, SNS
・Big Data / Analytics: Glue, EMR, Athena, Kinesis, ElasticSearch, Quicksight, Spark

Data
We require experience with one of the following:
・Computer vision and image processing
・Sensor processing and fusion
・Time series data processing
・Deep learning frameworks and building software on top of these frameworks such as PyTorch and Tensorflow

Soft Skills
・Excellent communication and organization skills
・Business level English
・Agile mindset
・Strong sense of ownership

Title: Data Engineer / Data Analyst
Company: GMP RECRUITMENT SERVICES S PTE LTD
Description:
Responsibilities: Create and maintain optimal data pipeline architecture, Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc. Apply architecture and system design theories and principles, perform complex work in research, design and development of new or existing products, tools and processes required for the operation, maintenance and testing of products. Build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and AWS Azure ‘big data’ technologies. Build analytics tools that utilize the data pipeline to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency and other key business performance metrics. Work with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data and Design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs. Embed DevOps processes in delivery – ensure usability is front of mind in Tech Product development. Keep our data separated and secure across national boundaries through multiple data centers and Azure platforms. Create data tools for analytics and data scientist team members that assist them in building and optimizing our product into an innovative industry leader. Work with data and analytics experts to strive for greater functionality in our data systems. Requirements: Degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Informatics, Information Systems or another quantitative field At least 5 years of relevant experiences in a Data Engineer role. Experience using the following software/tools: Experience with big data tools: Hadoop, Hive, Kafka, ELK (ECE), etc. Experience with relational SQL and NoSQL databases such as MSSQL, Postgres, Cassandra, MongoDB, TimeScaleDB Experience with mission-critical production development in following languages and frameworks a plus Languages: Java, Python, Web (HTML5, CSS, JS, XML, TS), Golang, VBA Frameworks: Angular, .NET, SciKitLearn, SciPy, NumPy, etc Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools: Airflow, Apache NiFi, Redis, Microsoft Office, Sharepoint, etc Experience with Azure cloud services: Blob Storage, Power BI, Logic Apps, Flow Apps, MSSQL Data Warehouse Experience with stream-processing systems: Storm, Spark, etc. Experience in Microsoft PowerBI implementation (Custom components, DAX, M) Additional Info: This is on 12 months contract basis Interested candidates must be open to work in the West To apply, please visit www.gmprecruit.com and search for Job Reference: 16057 To learn more about this opportunity, please contact Yingying at We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Title: Director of Product (Partner Experience), APAC
Description:
At foodpanda we're on a mission to redefine how tech, food, people and culture are connected operating in 12 countries worldwide. Our team is working on big challenges and complex scalability problems as we grow 6X annually processing millions of orders a year. You'll be part of a highly collaborative cross-functional agile squad that always includes frontend and backend engineers, design and product owners. Our squads operate in an open and fast-paced environment with very flat structures where everyone has a say.
We work on a large scale, complex systems where you can reach users on a global scale whilst enjoying a high level of autonomy and influence and a flexible working environment. Here you can learn, thrive and become a better engineer, designer and product manager.
Director of Product (Partner Experience), APAC
We are looking for a Director of Product to lead one of our tribes in Singapore. As a Director you will be responsible and accountable to define and deliver features that contribute to the growth of Restaurant Partner Services vertical across different markets.You'll define the value propositions, product Vision & strategy, go to market and KPIs we should focus on to make our Restaurant Partner's lives better and to grow foodpanda business.
You will work closely with engineers, product management and user experience designers to build best-in-class services and apps. You will liaise with other product management and leadership teams and work closely with business development, marketing, finance, legal to get feedback from partners ,customers and international teams to define and build product requirements in order to grow the business.
You will be helping in building an organization based on smart people, diversity, and individuals with a "can-do" attitude that want to build apps and services used daily by foodpanda customers and vendors worldwide.
What's on the menu:
Set the vision and strategy for foodpanda verticals with our executive and engineering teams.
You will directly manage a tribe and 8+ Products and Product managers who are focused on Partner service products
Execute a robust and comprehensive strategy, product roadmap, and business plan for foodpanda business
Define the roadmap, business requirements, measures of success, and features for your products and services, and work with your PM team to drive and deliver these to market.
Identify and execute on opportunities to drive up engagement for users
Grow revenue directly attributable to value created within foodpanda verticals
Operate strong feedback loops, identify and drive measurements, and creatively use data sources to craft better experiences and ensure we are building the right products over time.
Collaborate with marketing, business development, design, engineering, analytics, and other product managers to drive our business with meaningful value to our user base and to ensure alignment with Product strategy
Drive highly visible and impactful decisions for your area.
Keep apprised of new innovations and trends in the industry
What you can bring to the table:
10+ years of experience building complex software or application platforms (Mobile + Web)
5+ years experience in complex e-commerce product
7+ years in product management
7+ years managing organizations while still remaining hands-on to the details
5+ years directly managing product managers
Willing to take action and ambitious with ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic atmosphere
Thrive between the balance of customer experience and commercial needs
Able to deal with ambiguity and be able to break down barriers
Ability to balance priorities and multi-task
Experience in presenting to senior management and building consensus
Turn business requirements into a road map of features broken down by quarter
Maintain a prioritized backlog with clear and concise user stories
Sound product and execution skills and ability to perform under tight deadlines
Able to be very detailed while keeping an eye on the big picture
Define key requirements and go deep on the details as needed
Be the SME for the feature(s) / product you are driving
Develop metrics and reporting for features
Understand the systems and technologies behind your product, their limitations, scaling factors, boundary conditions, and reasons for architectural decisions.
Drive alignment across program and technology teams to deliver on stakeholder needs.
Experience in building platform solutions, defining services and applications
About foodpanda
foodpanda (small 'f') is the world's favourite way to order food online from the comfort of your home or office. Whether it's getting your hands on your favourite pasta, kebab or pizza, we believe that no one should have to suffer from hunger attacks ever again.
Our parent company, Delivery Hero, is a global leader in the food delivery industry processing over 3 million orders every day and operating in 40+ markets in the world, with 18,000 employees and approximately 500,000+ restaurant partners. In APAC, foodpanda operates in over 150 cities across 12 countries. Trivial problems can always become large technical challenges at scale. If you love technology, efficiency and simplicity as much as we do, there is no better place to experience this than in foodpanda.
We always genuinely care about experience, efficiency and scalability. We do not just solve technical problems but build the foundations for foodpanda's operations with the best tools on hand.

Title: Regional Digital Acquisition Lead
Description:
Key Responsibilities:
Lead the digital acquisition sales strategy, and implement best-in-class practices across paid and owned channels
Deliver against sales targets, and grow sales volumes for varied lines of business that depend on digital through different phases of the buying journey
Implement and measure campaigns to maximize channel performance across acquisition and cross-sell
Actively manage the funnel performance leveraging a data-first approach. Understand fall-out points throughout the conversion funnel and develop initiatives to increase yield and scale volume
Lead and execute the test and learn agenda across product, creative, media and digital customer experience across all screen sizes
Establish a framework for measurement for digital channel performance, including KPIs, benchmarks, and acceptable ROI
Identify and lead integration of new capabilities and technologies to improve digital targeting (DMP, DSP) and funnel performance (analytics)
Deliver key insights to business partners to continue to grow current and new portfolios
Lead a mobile-first approach, and design customer-centric digital sales experiences focused on continuous enhancements of the customer buying/application experience through personalization and optimization
Partner with data management platforms, information security teams and decision management teams across teams in Asia and EMEA
Partner with the marketing and product teams to engineer a communication framework relevant and impactful to the customer
Build relationships with, and leverage key media platforms across Asia and globally
Knowledge/Experience/Technical skills:
14+ years hands-on experience in digital performance/growth marketing, Media and Sales
Digital sales/e-commerce experience is required
Expert knowledge in Digital paid media including PPC, Programmatic, Social and Affiliates/Aggregators
Experience leveraging web traffic (Google Analytics, Adobe Site Catalyst, etc.) and personalization/testing platforms (Adobe Target, Optimizely)
Hands-on experience optimizing funnels (leads, conversion, retargeting, etc.)
Strong understanding of Martech/Adtech stacks tools and capabilities necessary to work with big data across the organization. Experience with Adobe Marketing Cloud a plus
Demonstrated ability to deliver results that are timely, relevant and effective, and strong people and project management skills
Experience managing large and complex projects across multiple countries and time zones
Be comfortable with getting into and working on detailed plans to drive speed of execution while staying focused on quality and sustenance of output
Exemplary leadership skills to be able to lead, influence and partner with teams across the organization to drive this new strategy and framework
Strong relationship building skills & experience of working in a matrix organization will be considered an advantage
This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required.

Title: Global Head of Solutions (Based in Singapore or Seattle)
Company: ViSenze - Artificial Intelligence for the Visual W...
Description:
ViSenze is one of the fastest growing A.I. start-ups and a recognised market leader in the development and implementation of visual recognition technology in retail. To help us build upon our success, we are seeking a Global Head of Solutions to be responsible for the implementation and management of Visenzes’ suite of AI Computer Vision Solutions. This is a newly created role that will suit an experienced executive with the right combination of customer focus, business acumen and an excellent technology pedigree.
Managing a Solutions Group comprising Solution Consultants and Solution Engineers and leading a cross-functional team in a matrix environment, you will liaise closely with our CTO and internal R&D and product teams, domain experts and external technology partners. With this team, you will manage the end to end delivery lifecycle for a defined roadmap of AI Computer Vision enabled solutions built upon Visenze’s market leading AI Computer Vision platform that solve challenging business problems for the Retail and Commerce industry.
Reporting to the CCO and working closely with the CEO and CTO, this role is a critical leadership role for Visenze as we help global Retailers and Brands transform every facet of their business with AI Computer Vision solutions.
Your team will:
Play a leading role in the development, expansion and refinement of ViSenze’s enhanced AI Computer Vision solutions for our customers globally
Play a proactive role in prioritising our Solution and Product roadmap for our AI Products and Solutions
Be a conduit and liaison with our Account Execs and Customer Success teams, between our customers, partners and engineering teams
Ensure success in helping our customers accelerate their adoption of our solutions; identifying unique problems and unlocking opportunities through your team of Solution Consultants and Engineers
Lead collaboration activities with major Technology and Solution Partners
Responsibilities
Managing a team of Solution Consultants and Engineers in pre-sales and solution implementation activities
Overseeing the development and ongoing enhancements to Visenze’s AI Computer Vision based Solutions
Coaching and mentoring Pre-Sales teams to successfully engage and conduct one-to-few and one-to-many training sessions to deliver technical understanding and training to customers adopting technology
Working with Visenze Account Execs to support sales and partnership activities with key ViSenze customers, vendors and third -party providers
Identifying strategic opportunities and mapping our Solutions to deliver optimised AI CV solutions to global retailers and brands across all channels
Serving as a leading solution expert in ViSenze and across the community, including and not limited to serving the most strategic Accounts globally
Helping customer facing teams to drive adoption of ViSenze solutions within strategic accounts, expanding usage across the enterprise by translating technical features into value drivers, selling through overcoming technical objections, responding to RFP technical documents, solution and persona-based selling
Establishing your presence as a Senior Go-To Leader in the business for Solution knowledge, positioning and technical understanding
Evangelising best practices in sales/solutioning engineering and leading by example and practice via engagements with top ViSenze clients globally
Requirements
15+ years’ experience in Technology Delivery and GTM roles (Technical Delivery Management / Solution Architecture, Solution Engineering)
Strong knowledge of E-Commerce / Retail industry through a Solutions Delivery, Consulting or Pre-Sales Leadership role where you’ve developed your client-facing and technical skills
5+ years management of technical, customer facing resources
5+ years supporting SaaS/Cloud Enterprise applications sales
Understanding of application standards and technologies relating to SaaS products and ability to communicate business value of SaaS products and product architectures
High energy, self-starter comfortable with ambiguity and rapid change inherent in fast growing, entrepreneurial environments
Outstanding professional, sales, communication, and technical capabilities;
Some knowledge and understanding of AI in Machine Learning, Big Data is preferable
Significant experience responding to RFPs and negotiating SLAs
Relevant degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Data Analytics or equivalent



About ViSenze
ViSenze powers visual commerce at scale with deep learning and computer vision. Used by the world's biggest retailers like Uniqlo and ASOS, ViSenze simplifies the way shoppers search and discover products; converting images into engagement opportunities, and making content shoppable. Today, ViSenze is acknowledged amongst top global AI startups by Interbrand, CognitionX, CBInsights, A100, VentureBeat, Datamation, eMarketer, and Forrester. The company has raised over USD34 million in funding to date from marque investors including Rakuten.
Ranked as top 10 tech companies in 2019 by Glassdoor in Singapore and an award winner of The Best Tech Company to Work For 2019, ViSenze offers a rare opportunity to join a thriving, fast-paced, multi-cultural environment and be part of a truly exciting journey of a pioneering A.I. company.
Visenze is also one of the founding AWS Global Retail Competency partners.

Title: VP / AVP, Principal / Senior Software Engineer, Digital Ecos...

Business Function

Group Technology and Operations (T&O) enables and empowers the bank with an efficient, nimble and resilient infrastructure through a strategic focus on productivity, quality & control, technology, people capability and innovation. In Group T&O, we manage the majority of the Bank's operational processes and inspire to delight our business partners through our multiple banking delivery channels.

Job responsibilities:

Write high quality, maintainable production code in an engineering-oriented environment
Work closely with Product team and Technical Architect to translate both business and non-functional requirements into scalable solutions, ensure compliance with platform architecture standards and patterns
Take end to end technical ownership of developed features being fully accountable for the efficient and high quality implementation based on relevant technology
Take responsibility for feature-focused unit and system testing, enforce test-driven development

Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure, fast paced agile environment
Degree/Diploma in Computer Science, Engineering or related field
Ability to work along with team distributed across geographies
Certification in AWS, Java, J2EE, ITIL would be an added advantage

Apply Now

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package and the professional advantages of a dynamic environment that supports your development and recognises your achievements.

Title: Head of Product (Marketing), APAC
Description:
At foodpanda we're on a mission to redefine how tech, food, people and culture are connected operating in 12 countries worldwide. Our team is working on big challenges and complex scalability problems as we grow 6X annually processing millions of orders a year. You'll be part of a highly collaborative cross-functional agile squad that always includes frontend and backend engineers, design and product owners. Our squads operate in an open and fast-paced environment with very flat structures where everyone has a say.
We work on a large scale, complex systems where you can reach users on a global scale whilst enjoying a high level of autonomy and influence and a flexible working environment. Here you can learn, thrive and become a better engineer, designer and product manager.
Head of Product (Marketing), APAC
We are looking for a Head of Product to lead one of our tribes in Singapore. As a Leader you will be responsible and accountable to define and deliver features that contribute to the growth of vertical across different markets.You'll define the value propositions, product Vision & strategy, go to market and KPIs we should focus on to grow the foodpanda business.
You will work closely with engineers, product management and user experience designers to build best-in-class services and apps. You will liaise with other product management and leadership teams and work closely with business development, marketing, finance, legal to get feedback from partners ,customers and international teams to define and build product requirements in order to grow the business.
You will be helping in building an organization based on smart people, diversity, and individuals with a "can-do" attitude that want to build apps and services used daily by foodpanda customers and vendors worldwide.
What's on the menu:
Set the vision and strategy for foodpanda verticals with our executive and engineering teams.
You will directly manage a tribe and 4+ Products and Product managers who are focused on marketing products
Execute a robust and comprehensive strategy, product roadmap, and business plan for foodpanda business
Define the roadmap, business requirements, measures of success, and features for your products and services, and work with your PM team to drive and deliver these to market.
Identify and execute on opportunities to drive up engagement for users
Grow revenue directly attributable to value created within foodpanda verticals
Operate strong feedback loops, identify and drive measurements, and creatively use data sources to craft better experiences and ensure we are building the right products over time.
Collaborate with marketing, business development, design, engineering, analytics, and other product managers to drive our business with meaningful value to our user base and to ensure alignment with Product strategy
Drive highly visible and impactful decisions for your area.
Keep apprised of new innovations and trends in the industry
What you can bring to the table:
10+ years of experience building complex software or application platforms (Mobile + Web)
5+ years experience in complex e-commerce products
7+ years in product management
7+ years managing organizations while still remaining hands-on to the details
5+ years directly managing product managers


Willing to take action and ambitious with ability to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic atmosphere
Thrive between the balance of customer experience and commercial needs
Able to deal with ambiguity and be able to break down barriers
Ability to balance priorities and multi-task
Experience in presenting to senior management and building consensus
Turn business requirements into a road map of features broken down by quarter
Maintain a prioritized backlog with clear and concise user stories
Sound product and execution skills and ability to perform under tight deadlines
Able to be very detailed while keeping an eye on the big picture
Define key requirements and go deep on the details as needed
Be the SME for the feature(s) / product you are driving
Develop metrics and reporting for features
Understand the systems and technologies behind your product, their limitations, scaling factors, boundary conditions, and reasons for architectural decisions.
Drive alignment across program and technology teams to deliver on stakeholder needs.
Experience in building platform solutions, defining services and applications
About foodpanda
foodpanda (small 'f') is the world's favourite way to order food online from the comfort of your home or office. Whether it's getting your hands on your favourite pasta, kebab or pizza, we believe that no one should have to suffer from hunger attacks ever again.
Our parent company, Delivery Hero, is a global leader in the food delivery industry processing over 3 million orders every day and operating in 40+ markets in the world, with 18,000 employees and approximately 500,000+ restaurant partners. In APAC, foodpanda operates in over 150 cities across 12 countries. Trivial problems can always become large technical challenges at scale. If you love technology, efficiency and simplicity as much as we do, there is no better place to experience this than in foodpanda.
We always genuinely care about experience, efficiency and scalability. We do not just solve technical problems but build the foundations for foodpanda's operations with the best tools on hand.

Title: Senior VP, Advanced Threat Research, Group Information Secur...
Description:
About UOBUnited Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.

Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.About the DepartmentThe Technology and Operations function is comprised of five teams of specialists with distinct capabilities: business partnership, technology, operations, risk governance and planning support and services. We work closely together to harness the power of technology to support our physical and digital banking services and operations. This includes developing, centralising and standardising technology systems as well as banking operations in Singapore and overseas branches.Job Responsibilities
Provide direct leadership, management, and operational oversight for our Level 3 engineers as well as execution of enhanced cyber security capabilities build-up programs.
Responsible for engineering design and development of cyber security technology along with integration of new architectural features into existing infrastructures while maintaining the integrity and security of enterprise-wide cyber security systems and networks.
Provide technical and security expertise to IT and business leadership and technical teams to identify cost-effective and appropriate security technology solutions and develop security reference architectures and strategies to achieve business results.
Develop/integrate cyber security solutions with multi-level security requirements for enhanced monitoring and detection capability
Maintain awareness of trends and issues in area of security expertise, evaluate new security technologies opportunities, and provide analysis of their potential advantage to the business.

Others:
Perform as a member of the Cyber security capability enhancement team to drive or participate in product evaluation, project discussion and deployments
Work within established practices and handling guidelines to develop and deploy preventive maintenance processes for GSOC infrastructure
Work with internal technical teams and engineers in technical troubleshooting, exercises and forums
Available to respond to client requests and assist with troubleshooting activities
Able to resolve customer related issues with minimal guidance
Communicate effectively with a variety of internal teams and external contacts including technical and executive contacts
Capable of juggling variety of priorities and deliverables in an interrupt driven environment with minimal guidance or supervision

Job Requirements

Education

Preferred Degree in engineering/Computer Science / IT/Cyber Security from a recognized education institution
Professional security related qualification (e.g. SANS GCIA, GCIH etc.) is favorable

Technical Skills and experience

Min 10-15 years of relevant Cyber security experience
Expert knowledge in networking technology and network security (i.e. Firewalls, WAF, IDS, IPS, VPN, HIPS, ADS, SIEM, UBA and TCP/IP protocols)
Minimum 5 years of relevant working experience in a SOC environment and leading a team of highly skilled Cyber Engineers
Familiar with SOC processes
Understanding of threat response and incident response
Understanding in Unix/Linux and Windows administration
Understanding in Security Information Event Management System (SIEMS) example: HP ArcSight / Splunk
Strong foundation in security threat TTPs and attack counter measure
Analytical problem solver and good at troubleshooting technical issues
Effective time management and organizational skills
Operational knowledge of SIEMS, Breach Detection System, Network Forensic System, Big Data analytics, User Behavior Analytics and endpoint security technology
Understanding of malware analysis platforms and tools
Understanding of threat intelligence platforms and tools
Technical/logical understanding of FW/IDS/IPS/WAF rule and SIEM rule construction
Programming, concepts and scripting languages – Python, Ruby, Power-shell, Java, C/C++, Regex, STIX
Good understanding of network forensics and packet analysis
Good understanding of SQL/Database, SOAP-XML, Restful API
Good understanding of internet concepts and technologies – internet services, search engines, open source tools, android/iOS - mobile technology, LAMP, iOT, TOR etc.

Soft Skills

Good written and verbal communication skills
Process and procedure adherence
Strong analytical and problem solving skill

Be a part of UOB FamilyApply now and make a difference.

Title: Regional Digital Acquisition Lead
Description:
Regional Digital Acquisition Lead
Innovative Environment
Data Driven Organization
Competitive Pay
My client is in the Banking sector and they are looking for a Regional Digital Acquisition Lead for their team. You will Lead the digital acquisition sales strategy, and implement best-in-class practices across paid and owned channels. As well as deliver against sales targets, and grow sales volumes for varied lines of business that depend on digital through different phases of the buying journey.
Responsibilities:
Implement and measure campaigns to maximize channel performance across acquisition and cross-sell
Actively manage the funnel performance leveraging a data-first approach. Understand fall-out points throughout the conversion funnel and develop initiatives to increase yield and scale volume
Lead and execute the test and learn agenda across product, creative, media and digital customer experience across all screen sizes
Establish a framework for measurement for digital channel performance, including KPIs, benchmarks, and acceptable ROI
Identify and lead integration of new capabilities and technologies to improve digital targeting (DMP, DSP) and funnel performance (analytics)
Deliver key insights to business partners to continue to grow current and new portfolios
Lead a mobile-first approach, and design customer-centric digital sales experiences focused on continuous enhancements of the customer buying/application experience through personalization and optimization
Partner with data management platforms, information security teams and decision management teams across teams in Asia and EMEA
Partner with the marketing and product teams to engineer a communication framework relevant and impactful to the customer
Build relationships with, and leverage key media platforms across Asia and globally
Qualifications:
14+ years hands-on experience in digital performance/growth marketing, Media and Sales
Digital sales/e-commerce experience is required
Expert knowledge in Digital paid media including PPC, Programmatic, Social and Affiliates/Aggregators
Experience leveraging web traffic (Google Analytics, Adobe Site Catalyst, etc.) and personalization/testing platforms (Adobe Target, Optimizely)
Hands-on experience optimizing funnels (leads, conversion, retargeting, etc.)
Strong understanding of Martech/Adtech stacks tools and capabilities necessary to work with big data across the organization. Experience with Adobe Marketing Cloud a plus
Demonstrated ability to deliver results that are timely, relevant and effective, and strong people and project management skills
Experience managing large and complex projects across multiple countries and time zones
Be comfortable with getting into and working on detailed plans to drive speed of execution while staying focused on quality and sustenance of output
Exemplary leadership skills to be able to lead, influence and partner with teams across the organization to drive this new strategy and framework

Title: SWAT Director - Emerging Technologies
Description:
As part of their aggressive 2020 recruitment plans, a global bank with a strong regional footprint has made available a SWAT Director - Emerging Technologies job to build and lead the new corporate banking APAC "SWAT" technology team.
About the SWAT Director - Emerging Technologies Role:
Aside from delivering innovative digital and data solutions across Singapore, Shanghai and Hong Kong, you will lead a team that acts as a rapid application development style team taking forward new digital and data solutions from ideas to fruition within the APAC market. Projects will cover topics such as data visualisation/analytics, client APIs, RPA/process automation, document digitisation/OCR, distributed ledger solutions and machine learning/artificial intelligence. Deliveries will be aimed to increase revenue, improve client services and be cost efficient.
Key Responsibilities:
Develop new technology applications/services in partnership with business and operations stakeholders to transform the GTB business
Lead a team of engineers to design and build software for the corporate bank division
Partner with UI/UX design team, architects, business analysts and stakeholders situated in multiple regions and time zones, at varying capacity to understand requirements
Shape the future of the technology stack and apply it innovatively to solve complex problems
Act as the technical advocate for new technologies such as Kafka, Hadoop, Kubernetes, Dockers, etc., and how to leverage these in a corporate environment
Design and develop source code, including descriptions, for all software components, in accordance with detailed software requirements specification, the functional design and the technical design document
Embrace automated unit/integration testing as a standard development practice
Promote a DevOps culture and modern tool chains to support continuous delivery
To succeed in this SWAT Director - Emerging Technologies role, you must be passionate about the latest tech stack, previously ran MVPs/POCs and have prior experience delivering business benefit whilst building new modern and efficient solutions that incrementally replace or compliment their existing platforms and strategic road map.
Key Requirements:
Strong experience in AI or Data Analytics/Big Data advantageous
Desirable to have experience building machine learning models for recommending products and actions
Experience in C#/Java/Groovy programming in digitisation and data extraction from documents using AI and robotic process automation is preferred
Master’s degree in computer science, computer engineering or information technology
Eight years' hands-on experience developing Microservices using Spring Boot framework
Five years' hands-on experience with Kafka message/event stream-processing
Five years' hands-on experience with Hadoop (Spark, HBASE, Impala)
Three years' hands-on experience with React, HTML, CSS (UI development)
Three years' hands-on experience with enterprise search platforms such as Elastic and/or Solr+
Two years' hands-on experience with Oracle 12c or higher Hands-on experience developing solutions on Linux Rhel6.x or higher OS
Application development experience using Agile Methodology, Scrum Master certification is preferred
Strong server-side Java development skills. Ability to develop reusable and performant Java aligned with good architectural and design principles
Experience with test driven development (TDD) and writing automated tests
Sound understanding of DevOps practices and software toolchain. Practical experience with modern DevOps build chains and CI/CD tools (Maven, Gradle, Git, Jenkins or TeamCity)
Experience in deployment to container environments (Docker, Kubernetes)
Scripting experience in Bash or Python is a plus
Knowledge in corporate banking business is ideal. Candidates without banking experience are strongly encouraged to apply
The successful candidate will join a technology-centric business, with an increasing move to real-time processing, an increasing appetite from customers for integrated systems and access to supporting data.
If you are seeking an opportunity to partner with a team that works on diverse range of solutions using cutting-edge technology every day, a team that is equipped with modern technologies and use modern practices including micro-services development, DevOps and more, that works with many open source tools including Apache Kafka, Flink, ElasticSearch, Apache Spark and Open shift, this SWAT Director - Emerging Technologies role is right for you.
Interested candidates, please apply today.

Title: Lead Data Engineer (Hadoop / Python / MatLab)
Description:
Opportunity to work with Advanced Technologies
High Impact Position
About Our Client
Our client is an upcoming Technology Platform and they are looking for a highly motivated Lead Data Engineer (Hadoop / Python / MatLab) to work with a diverse team of technical resources, product managers and develop advanced technology solutions.
Job Description
As the Lead Data Engineer (Hadoop / Python / MatLab), you are responsible for:
Identifying, reviewing, and determining the value of unstructured data from multiple sources before designing scalable systems to ingest the relevant data.
Developing the blueprint design for the data architecture on cloud platforms, ensuring scalability and efficiency.
Owning the data pipelines and driving continuous improvements in data quality reports.
Designing data models to support analytics reports, data transformation and data science models.
Collaborating with Industry Experts and Software Engineers to refine the selection of data sources and optimize the data collection process.
The Successful Applicant
As a successful applicant, you will have a Degree in Business Analytics or equivalent with at least 5 years of experience in the Data Engineering field, backed by strong working experience with both unstructured and structured data. You will also have a proven track record of working with Big Data tools such as Hadoop / Spark / Hive, coupled with relevant scripting experience using Python with NoSQL databases such as MongoDB / PostgreSQL.
You will have a strong experience with statistical programming tools such as MatLab / R / SAS in a UNIX / LINUX environment. You will also have relevant experience with data modelling and creating predictive models.

Title: Research Engineer
Description:
The Living Analytics Research Centre (LARC) is a research centre set up in Singapore Management University (SMU) with Carnegie Mellon University (CMU) as our strategic partner that focuses Urban and Community Liveability, Personalised Urban Mobility, Jobs and Skills Intelligence, as well as Smart Consumption andHealthy Lifestyle. Candidates who join us can also expect to gain a deeper knowledge in the following areassuch as Big Data Analytics, Data Mining, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Human Computer Interaction, Urban Computing and other relevant disciplines. The candidate will be working on key initiatives and projects with internal or external partners in the followingaspects: Conduct research in the above areas Gather requirements from project partners through discussions and correspondence Develop, design and implement research prototypes and test-bed systems to achieve project requirements and targets, as well as to showcase the centre’s analytics capabilities Showcase LARC’s projects at events or conferences Assist other researchers to collect and extract relevant data for research purposes Qualifications Bachelor/Master Degree in Computer Science or relevant disciplines Good knowledge of Databases, Data Mining, Distributed Computing, Operating Systems Proficient in at least one or more of these programming languages: Java, Python, C#, C++, C Experience in the following technologies will be beneficial: Elasticsearch Apache Storm RabbitMQ Redis MySQL, Postgresql Tomcat, NodeJS, Apache, Nginx and Xampp Linux Environment (CentOS 6.x, Ubuntu 14.x), Bash Scripting Virtualization (VMWare, KVM, Vagrant, Docker) GPU Computing and Deep Learning Self-motivated and able to carry out tasks independently Excellent team player and possess strong inter-personal skill

Bachelor's / Honours, Masters / PhD

Title: Technical Program Manager - Connected Vehicle
Description:
About Hyundai-Aptiv Autonomous Driving Joint Venture

The Hyundai-Aptiv Autonomous Driving Joint Venture develops world class production-ready autonomous driving systems. The joint venture leverages Hyundai Motor Group’s design, engineering, and manufacturing expertise and Aptiv’s autonomous driving solutions to commercialize an SAE Level 4 platform for robotaxi providers, fleet operators, and automotive manufacturers.

Headquartered in Boston, the Hyundai-Aptiv Autonomous Driving Joint Venture has operations in the US and Asia. An official name for the new joint venture will be unveiled soon!

We are seeking talented Technical Program Managers to help develop and roll out the next generation of our advanced tools to support autonomous driving.
What you'll be expected to do:
We’re looking for a talented Lead software engineer for our VATS team (Validations Analytics Testing and Simulation).
Build a scalable compute platform that is used throughout the company, enabling a diverse set of teams to test and validate their software. The availability and performance of our platform is critical in ensuring the safety of the Autonomous Vehicles we put on the road.
Communicate with stakeholders and team leads for requirement of software product / product lines.Set team’s short term and long term goals, provide vision to the team.
Lead teams of developers / testers / operators to achieve goals, using suitable software engineering approach.
Manage the timelines associated with delivering a product
Implement key portions of the system
What we'll hope you come with
Previous experience leading a team developing cloud-based software
2-5 years of technical leadership experience
The ideal candidate would be knowledgeable in big data, cloud infrastructure/deployment, database systems (relational and NoSQL), containerization, and some combination of Python, C# and/or Java
Strong written and oral communication skillsMS, BS or BA in Computer Science / Engineering
Bonus points if you have
Experience with Amazon Web Services, Docker, and Terraform
Experience with .NET core and Python
Experience with JavaScript / React / Redux
Experience with large scale compute

Title: #SGUNITEDJOBS APPLICATION DEVELOPER
Description:
5+ years of experience in a Data Engineer role
Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational and columnar databases and database partitioning.
Experience building and optimizing ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures and data sets
Experience performing root cause analysis on internal and external data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
Strong analytic skills related to working with structured/unstructured datasets.
Build processes supporting data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency and workload management.
Working knowledge of message queuing, stream processing, and highly scalable ‘big data’ data stores.
Preferably with the experience of using the following software/tools:
Experience with big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, RabbitMQ etc.
Experience with NoSQL/NewSQL databases.
Experience with AWS cloud services: EC2, EMR, RDS, Redshift
Experience with either of these languages: Python, Java.

Title: Lead Consultant
Description:
Role Summary
You will be responsible for building the business' data collection systems and processing highly available data pipelines that facilitate deeper analysis and reporting by the business users. You will also be building data processing frameworks that handle the business's growing database and will work with the business users in leveraging data with reporting and scientific tools. In addition, you will strive to continuously develop new and improved data engineering capabilities.

Job Responsibilities
Implement strategies directed at acquiring data and promoting the development of new insights across the business. You will own and extend the business's data pipeline through the collection, storage, processing, and transformation of large data-sets.
Monitor the existing metrics, analyze data, and work with business users to identify and implement system and process improvements.
Develop queries for ad hoc business projects, as well as ongoing reporting. In this capacity, you will build a metadata system where all available data is maintained and catalogued. You will also play a major role in the development of reliable data pipelines that translate raw data into powerful features and signals.
Designs, architects, implements, and supports key datasets that avail structured and timely access to actionable business insights. You will also be responsible with developing ETL processes that convert data into formats through dashboard charts.
Work closely with the business users in gathering requirements for data governance across the department and the business at large.
Apply best practices as well as defining the business's data requirements, which will ensure that the collected data is of a high quality and optimal for use across the departments and business at large.
Analyze and understand data sources, participating in design, and providing insights and guidance on database technology and data modelling best practices.
Develop and manage scalable data processing platforms that will be used for exploratory data analysis and real-time analytics. You will oversee, design, and develop algorithms for real-time data processing within the business and to create the frameworks that enable quick and efficient data acquisition.
Retrieve and analyze data using SQL, Excel among other data management systems. You will also build data loading services for importing data from numerous disparate data sources, inclusive of APIs, logs, relational, and non-relational databases.
Contribute to the continual improvement of the business's data platforms.
Job Requirements
Degree in Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, Information Technology or related fields.
Relevant experience in working within a data engineering department, preferably as a Data Engineer in a fast-paced environment and complex business setting
Demonstrate experience in building and maintaining reliable and scalable ETL on big data platforms as well as experience working with varied forms of data infrastructure inclusive of relational databases such as SQL, Hadoop, Spark and column-oriented databases such as Redshift, MySQL, and Vertica.
Experience in data warehousing inclusive of dimensional modelling concepts and demonstrate proficiency in scripting languages, for example, Python, Perl, etc.
Experience in working in SQL server reporting services, analysis services, Tableau, Salesforce, integration services, or any other data visualization tools.
Ability to perform complex data analyses with large data volumes.
Proficient in SQL, Java, and have a keen understanding of data models and data warehouse concepts.
Experience working with big data infrastructure tools such as Python, SQS, Redshift, Scala, Spark, Spark Streaming, AWS and/or EMR.

Title: Software Engineer/Architect for Video Service Quality
Description:
Summary
Posted: Dec 10, 2019
Role Number:200129743
Do you like the idea of working on services that are used by millions of passionate people around the world? Do you enjoy working on challenges that are not yet solved? Do you want to change the world? Imagine what you could do here at Apple! Apple puts users and user experience first, and is a place where new futuristic ideas and innovations have a way of becoming extraordinary products, services and the present very quickly. Apple Media Products is looking for a brilliant self starter to join the Video Service Quality team. A great engineer, and a visionary software tools architect who can review, plan and influence key innovations that will deliver the best-in-class video experiences for the users.
Key Qualifications
Building systems and delivering internet services at scale
Working in Linux or Unix environments and ability to tune for performance (e.g. disk or memory)
Skill using devops and automation tools (e.g. chef, Jenkins)
Architecting or storing data in NoSQL, Relational or Big data technologies (e.g. Hadoop, MongoDB/CouchDB, Spark)
Java and JVM technologies and run-time configurations
Experience with other systems like containers and message queues (e.g. Kafka, Apache, Jetty)
Infrastructure knowledge of networks, CDNs, load balancers
Agile development with code tools like svn and git
App/software design and API development using Java, JS, HTML5 etc
In-depth knowledge of video ecosystem and delivery of large scale video
Aptitude to independently network, learn, and influence cross-functional teams
Good written and communication skills
Ability to organize, plan and deliver against key milestones
Description
Apple Media Products is looking for a software engineering to provide new and enhanced architecture, software, tools and monitoring to support its fast paced growth. Join our exciting team that is dedicated to providing the highest quality video products to our customers. Our team is responsible for the software that drive real-time end-to-end video service quality and influence the performance and architecture of delivering video. We are looking for a team player who is able to tackle problems under a tight deadline constraints and deliver imaginative solutions. Responsibilities will include: tools and applications to support measuring and monitoring video quality, building data analytics and real-time dashboards, driving innovations to deliver best-in-class video optimizations, and finally working across Apple from customer care to core platforms to build the capabilities.
Education & Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science and Engineering or related field 10+ years of industry experience
